She sells women's shoes and clothing to people in her neighborhood, near the Metropolitan Stadium in Barranquilla, a Colombian soccer field. 

Celia has applied for a Kiva loan, which is the first financing she requests from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to purchase shoes, blouses, and jeans, which are her most popular items. This will allow her to increase her stock and also her sales. 

Some day she would like to open her own retail store, or perhaps go to cooking school at SENA, because cooking is another of her main passions.

loans.use: to purchase shoes, blouses, and jeans.

loans.name: Leonicia

texts.es:
La señora Leonicia  de 56 años de edad, es madre  soltera tiene 1 hija que dependen de ella, tiene casa propia y se dedica desde hace 10 años al negocio de venta de tortillas y frescos, en su casa tiene una pequeña pulpería, su venta es con los vecinos y amigos que a diario le visitan, radica en la comunidad de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras, Doña Leonicia  es una mujer trabajadora y con muchos deseos de salir adelante y es muy honrada  en sus compromisos.
Doña Leonicia esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de maíz, leña, frescos, churros y galletas. Con el apoyo de este préstamo ella pretende suplir la necesidad de financiamiento para su negocio ya que desea comprar la materia prima para seguir elaborando las tortillas y  surtir su pequeña pulpería de esta manera salir adelante con su familia. Ella esta muy contenta de seguir trabajando con Prisma en sus préstamos y su sueño es mejorar su casa.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Octubre del 2012.
texts.en:
Leonicia, 56, is a single mother of one dependent daughter.  She owns a house and for the last ten years has been in the business of selling tortillas and fruit drinks.  She has a small grocery store at home and she sells to neighbors who visit her store daily.  She lives in the community of San Lorenzo in south Honduras.  Leonicia is a hardworking woman who very much wants to get ahead and is very honest with her commitments.

Leonicia is requesting a loan to buy corn, firewood, fruit drinks, snacks and cookies.  With support from this loan she intends to cover her business’ financial need because she wants to buy raw materials to continue making tortillas and to stock her small grocery store to get ahead with her family this way.  She’s very happy to continue working with Prisma loans and her dream is to make some home improvements.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - October, 2012.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, snacks, cookies,etc.

loans.name: Jefrry Manuel

texts.es: Jeffry Manuel, tiene la edad  de 21 años, está soltero, vive con sus padres y hermanos  que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar mano de otra en trabajos de siembra y asistencia para el café. Además de poder comprar unas plantas de almácigo para realizar siembras y así aumentar la densidad de plantas por área, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras que favorecen al cultivo de café. Con esta nueva siembras de cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas personales.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Jeffry Manuel, 21, is single living with his parents and siblings who are his greatest priority.  He intends to use his loan to buy fertilizer, fungicide and to pay labor costs to do coffee crop maintenance tasks.  He will also be able to buy seedlings to plant thus increasing the plant density by area as well as taking advantage of the good fertility of the soil, weather and other conditions that are favorable for coffee growing.  He hopes to earn a bit of profit from this new coffee crop to improve his family’s living condition and also to invest a bit more in his crops and also to meet some personal goals.  This is his first Fudecosur loan.  He’s had no others from state banks and Fudecosur offered the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Janeth Mercedes

texts.es:
La joven Janeth es una persona emprendedora y responsable, junto con el viven su esposo y su hija en el Sur de Honduras. Sus ingresos son los que percibe por su negocio que es la venta de repuestos para impresoras.
Janeth el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de tóner, impresoras, tinta, Mouse`s y memorias usb. Con el préstamo espera incrementar sus ventas para ofrecer una mejor gama de mercadería a sus clientes, así mismo seguir mejorando la calidad de vida de la familia.
En el futuro Janeth desea poder comprar una propiedad de esta manera poder tener su propio local. Y seguir apoyando a su esposo y a su familia ya que son de escasos recursos económicos.
Choluteca, Honduras – Octubre 2012
texts.en:
Janeth is an entrepreneurial and responsible young woman who lives with her husband and daughter in the southern region of Honduras.  Her income is what she gets from her business, which is sales of parts and accessories for printers.

Janeth needs this loan to buy toner, printers, ink, computer mice, and USB drives.  With this loan, she hopes to increase her sales and offer a greater range of products to her customers and continue improving her family's life.

In the future, Janeth wants to be able to buy her own property and have her own business location there.  She also wants to continue supporting her husband and family who don't have many other resources.

Choluteca, Honduras – October, 2012

loans.use: to buy toner, printers, ink, computer mice, and USB drives for her business.

loans.name: Mirian Suyapa

texts.es:
La señora Mirian de 41 años es casada, vive con su esposo y  tiene 3  hijos que dependen de ella, tiene casa propia y se dedica desde hace 2 años al negocio de venta de artículos de madera, como ser: chifonieres, camas, mubles de sala, comedor, sillas, puertas, camas, muebles de cocina y mas,  su venta es en su taller y de manera ambulante Doña Mirian es una mujer trabajadora y con muchos deseos de salir adelante en su negocio.
Doña Mirian esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de materia prima como ser: madera de cedro para elaborar los muebles y pinturas. Con el apoyo de este préstamo ella pretende suplir la necesidad de financiamiento para su negocio ya que desea comprar la materia prima para seguir elaborando las muebles y de esta manera salir adelante con su negocio, esta muy contenta de seguir trabajando con Prisma en sus préstamos.
Doña Mirian su sueño es  tener una comercial grande donde pueda vender otras cosas aparte de muebles.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Octubre del 2012.
texts.en:
Mirian, 41, is married living with her husband; she has three children that depend on her.  She owns her house and for the last two years has been working in a business selling wood furniture like chests of drawers, beds, living room sets, dining room sets, chairs, doors, beds, kitchen cabinets and others.  She sells both in her workshop and from place to place.  Mirian is a hardworking woman who very much wants to get ahead in her business.

Mirian is requesting a loan to buy raw materials like cedar wood and paint.  With support from this loan she intends to cover the business’ financial need because she wants to buy raw materials to continue manufacturing furniture and get ahead with her business this way.  She’s very happy to continue working with Prisma loans.  Mirian’s dream is to have a large store where she can sell other things besides furniture.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - October, 2012.

loans.use: to buy cedar and paint.

loans.name: Maboudou

texts.fr:
Mr MABOUDOU est célibataire sans enfant et n’a personne à sa charge.
Il est étudiant en classe de Master II professionnelle à l’ESTPO (Ecole Supérieure des Travaux Public de Ouagadougou) depuis 04ans.
Mr veut financer ses études supérieures.
Il compte après ses études travailler dans une grande entreprise de la place pendant au moins trois ans avant de se marié. Avec le temps, il compte créer son propre entreprise dans le domaine de Génie Civil.
texts.en:
Mr MABOUDOU is single. He has no children and no dependents.

He has been studying at ESTPO (Graduate School of Public Works of Ouagadougou) for almost four years. He is currently in the final class before obtaining a Master’s degree in technology.

Mr. MABOUDOU wants to finance his graduate studies. When he has completed them, he intends on working in a reputable local company for at least three years before getting married. In time, he plans to create his own business in the Public Works sector.

loans.use: finance his graduate studies.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama   is a petty trader. She sells panties, ladies' wear, children's dresses and underwear at  Nkramfokrom  near Cape Coast. She has been in this business for the past 10 years now.  

Ama  is married. She uses her income to help her husband  to pay their utility and accommodation bills.  She  need this loan to enable her to purchase more underwear and ladies' and children's dresses  to sell. With the new profit, she plans to acquire a shop for the sale of her dresses.

loans.use: to purchase more underwear and  ladies' and children's dresses  to sell

loans.name: Justina

texts.en: Justina sells maize at Amoanda  near Cape Coast. She is a widow  and has four children.    As a single parent,  she uses her income  to feed and  clothe her children and pay their school fees.   Justina needs this loan to purchase bags of maize for sale. With the new profit,  Justina  wishes to acquire a large quantity of maize to distribute to retailers.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize for sale.

loans.name: 15 De Junio (Flat) Group

texts.es:
La señora Teresa tiene la edad de 59 años, solo estudio la primaria,  y esta soltera pues sus hijos ya se encuentran casadas. Ella desde muy pequeña inicio a trabajar y a base de sus esfuerzo saco adelante a sus hijos pero actualmente ella realiza venta de antojitos mexicanos los fines de semana (Viernes, Sábados y Domingos) en un pequeño corredor que construyo enfrente de su casa también entre semana saca sus ventas de variedad de dulces y chicharrones.
Como ya tiene 4 años con sus ventas la gente del pueblo ya la conoce y además comentan que tiene un muy rico sazón lo cual le ayuda a atraer mas clientes.
Con este préstamo Doña Teresa comprara chiles, tomates, cebollas, carne, papas, huevos, tortillas, maíz, queso, crema, lechuga, frijoles, aceite, refrescos y variedad de dulces.
Ella espera que con esta inversión su negocio prospere y así poner tener una mejor vida.

Ella es integrante de 15 de Junio el cual esta integrado por 11 personas y se ubica en la comunidad de Tetela la cual se caracteriza por estar en una región cañera y su gente se dedica a la siembra y cultivo de caña de azúcar. Los demás integrantes del grupo son: Maria Maribel taller de costura, Maria del Rosario joyería y cerámica, Maria manualidades, Cirilo venta de ropa, Fermin repostería, Maria Josefina venta pan, Clara Luz venta de comida, Micaela venta de lencería, Maria Santos venta de ropa, Denisse venta de bisutería.

Nota: La señora de Blusa Amarilla es mama de Maria del Rosario y se a tomado la foto con el grupo en representación de su hija
texts.en:
Teresa is 59 years old. She only completed primary school and she lives alone, since her children are already married. She started working as a very young child, and through much effort she managed to raise her children. Currently she sells traditional corn-based Mexican dishes on the weekends (Friday, Saturday, and Sunday) at a small corridor that she built in front of her home. During the week she also brings out a variety of sweets and pork rinds to sell. 

She has been doing this for four years, so the people in town already know her and they also mention she is a very gifted cook, which helps her attract more customers.

Teresa will use this loan to purchase chiles, tomatoes, onions, meat, potatoes, eggs, tortillas, corn, cheese, cream, lettuce, beans, oil, soft drinks, and assorted sweets. She expects her business to prosper from this investment so that she can have a better life.

She belongs to 15 de Junio, which comprises eleven members and is located in the community of Tetela, which is known for being in a sugarcane-producing region. Its people work planting and growing sugarcane. The other members of the group are: Maria Maribel, who has a sewing shop; Maria del Rosario, who sells jewelry and ceramics; Maria, who makes crafts; Cirilo, who sells clothing; Fermin, who is a baker; Maria Josefina, who sells bread; Clara Luz, who sells food; Micaela, who sells lingerie; Maria Santos, who sells clothing; and Denisse, who sells costume jewelry.

Note: The lady in the yellow top is Maria del Rosario's mother and had her picture taken on her daughter's behalf.

loans.use: to purchase chiles, tomatoes, onions, meat, potatoes, eggs, tortillas, corn, cheese, cream, lettuce, beans, oil, soft drinks, and assorted sweets.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
La señora Teresa tiene 30 años vive en la zona sur de Honduras, junto con ella viven sus hijos y su esposo quien la apoya en su actividad comercial, su negocio es venta de comida y golosinas trabajo que realiza desde hace 5 años, su negocio se encuentra en un punto estratégico donde la fluidez es en grandes cantidades y esto hace que sea muy visitado.
Doña Teresa el crédito lo necesita para la compra de maíz, frijoles, arroz, carne, huevos, embutidos, refrescos, verduras etc.  El impacto esperado con el crédito es que sus ventas crezcan en gran manera, ya que comprara bastante producto y así poder satisfacer cada uno de los pedidos que le hacen a diario sus clientes.
Doña Teresa los planes a futuro es seguir creciendo en su actividad comercial y llegar a tener un restaurante, para generarse mejores ingresos y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

Choluteca, Honduras - Octubre del 2012
texts.en:
Teresa, 30, lives in the south of Honduras with her children and husband who supports her economic activity.  Her business is selling food and snacks, work she’s been doing for five years.  Her business is located in a strategic spot with many passersby and this makes it highly visited.

Teresa needs the loan to buy corn, beans, rice, meat, eggs, canned goods, soft-drinks, vegetables, etc.  She expects the impact of this loan will be greatly increased sales because she will buy quite a bit of product to be able to meet each and every order placed daily by her customers.  In the future, Teresa plans to continue growing with her commercial activity and come to own a restaurant to generate better income and provide better quality of life for her family.

Choluteca, Honduras - October, 2012

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, rice, meat, eggs, canned goods, soft-drinks, vegetables,etc.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama  is a food vender who cooks  a variety of foods  for sale.  Some of the foods are:    rice, yams and  vegetable stew,   'banku' (fermented corn dough)  with okra and  "kenkey" (maize dough)  with  fish stew. She has done this for 5 years. She lives together with her husband and 6 dependents at  Nkramofokoom near Cape Coast.  

Ama uses her income to assist her husband to pay their children’s school fees.   Ama  will  use her loan  to purchase bags of rice,  yams,  maize, fish and other  ingredients  to  prepare her food  to sell.  She hopes to use the new profits from her business  to create a place for her customers to eat.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice,  yams,  maize, fish and other  ingredients  to  prepare her food

loans.name: Adwowa

texts.en: Adwowa   sells footwear  at  Nkramofokrom  near Cape Coast.  She is a single parent  and has two children.     Adwowa  has been selling footwear  for 5  years now.   As a single parent she uses her income to  feed her family and in paying her  children’s school fees.  She will use her loan to purchase more footwear to sell.  She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shop for the sale of her footwear.

loans.use: to purchase more footwear  to  sell

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina is 38 years old and a native of the town of Msambweni. Her business is selling juice, and she has been in this business for three years. The loan will be used to buy a freezer and a blender. Amina works a lot, since this is her only source of income that allows her to support herself and to help her family with household expenses. She is grateful to the institution for the support it has provided her.

loans.use: to buy a freezer and a blender.

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en:
Ahmed is a farmer. He cultivates and harvests maize, beans, and cassava for sale at Nkromofokrom near Cape Coast. Ahmed has completed middle school form four. He is married to a trader.   

Ahmed has been into this business for ten years now. He uses his income to pay his utility and accommodation bills.  

Ahmed will use his loan to hire labour to work on his farm to enable him to harvest more maize, rice, beans, and cassava.  Ahmed plans to expand his farm with the new profit.

loans.use: to hire labour to work on his farm to enable him to harvest more maize, rice, beans, and cassava.

loans.name: Satta

texts.en:
Satta, age 38, lives with her friend in Paynesville South. Her friend is a driver. Satta has three children who are between the ages of 7 and 18. Two of the children stay with her at home and are currently in school while the other child stays with her aunt. 

For the past 15 years, Satta has been selling soft drinks and alcoholic drinks. She loves to operate this type of business because she makes a profit. Her drinks are always cool to satisfy her customers. She also interacts with different kinds of people every day.  

She has requested a loan to purchase more soft drinks and alcoholic drinks, including beer, stout and gin, for the business. Her plan for the future is to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks and alcoholic drinks for the business.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es: Juan Francisco de veintisiete años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos en casa propia, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y ha adquirido valiosa experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, el terreno donde cultiva tiene un alto potencial agrícola, esta apto para la siembra y muy cercano a su vivienda, además para complementar los gastos del hogar posee una venta de ganado, comercia en todos los alrededores de la comunidad y tiene mucha clientela que lo prefiere por la calidad de producto, los buenos precios pero sobre todo por el excelente servicio siempre a la disposición de los clientes; Juan es un hombre emprendedor con muchas ganas de salir adelante, se dedica con gran esfuerzo y dedicación a su labor esta seguro que solo así logará el éxito que tanto desea; en la ultima temporada de siembra tuvo algunas perdidas debido a los cambios de clima y quiere recuperarse pero para ello necesita de capital que lo respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ganado, semilla de maíz, frijol, insecticida, herbicida, etc. Juan Francisco tiene buenas referencias de pago por parte de sus conocidos y esta muy contento con la ayuda por eso se hace responsable de cancelar la deuda y a la vez tiene la esperanza que le dará a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
Juan Francisco, 27, lives with his life companion and their children in his own house.  He works growing corn and beans and has worked in agriculture for several years; he’s acquired valuable experience that makes it possible for him to obtain the best harvests.  The parcel of land he farms has high agricultural potential; it’s apt for farming and it’s very near his house.  In addition, he earns extra income selling cattle.  He sells all around the community and has a large clientele that prefers him for the quality of his product, the good prices and above all the excellent customer service he always provides.

Juan is an enterprising man who very much wants to get ahead.  He puts much effort and dedication into his work because he’s sure this is only way to attain the success he so desires.  He had some losses last growing season due to weather changes that he’d like to recuperate but needs capital to back him up to do so which is why he’s asking INTEGRAL for a loan to buy cattle, corn and bean seeds, insecticide, herbicide, etc.

Juan Francisco has good payment references from his acquaintances and he’s very happy with the help which is why he commits to repay the loan while at the same time he hopes to provide a fulfilled life for his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, farm supplies and cattle.

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJIGUIYA est constitué de six femmes mariées et deux célibataires. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 27 ans et 3 enfants et vivent majoritairement dans des  familles nucléaires dans le quartier Heremakono Nord  de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles adhérent à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur premier prêt. Ce groupe de femmes fait  l’achat vente de condiments alimentaires, de colliers, de parures, de perles de toutes sortes.FANTA, qui est la présidente du groupe  est la première femme de la gauche vers la droite. FANTA compte acheter avec son  prêt, 2 cartons de cube maggi avec les grossistes de BOUGOUNI . Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The group DJIGUIYA is composed of six married women and two unmarried women. They average 27 years of age and have three children. They live for the most part in nuclear families in the Heremakono Nord district of Bougouni City. 

They know one another through ties of community, friendship, and commerce. To bolster their financial capacity, so as to do better in business, they joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their first loan. This group of women buys and sells condiments, necklaces, fine goods, and beads of all kinds. 

FANTA, who is the group's president, is the first woman at the left in the photo. She intends to use her loan to purchase 2 boxes of Maggi bouillon cubes from BOUGOUNI wholesalers. Accepting cash or credit from a customer base composed essentially of women, she makes her sales retail at the market and at home. 

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 25,000 francs CFA that will be invested in her business and used to repay the loan.

loans.use: to  purchase condiments to sell

loans.name: Alimatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 28-year-old Alimatu from Moriba town Bo in the southern area. She is the mother of one child, age 8. Her child is currently attending school. 

Alimatu runs a general store business; she sells waxed cotton, lace and suitcases. She has been running this business for five years. She works at the business nine hours per day and six days per week. She has two relatives who help her run her business. Her business is the only income she has. Alimatu says that the main challenge to her business is the high cost of transportation and inflation.

Alimatu has requested a loan in order to buy a variety of stock such as waxed cotton, lace and suitcases for resell. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her child and improve her level of living. In the future, she plans to expand her business to a shop level. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy a variety of stock such as waxed cotton, lace and suitcases for resell.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 26-year-old Fatmata from Moriba town, Southern Bo, Southern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with one child, age two years. She began her business because she did not go to school and she needs a permanent income to support the home.

Fatmata runs a palm oil business within a busy market area. She sells gallons of palm oil. She has been running this business for four years. She works at the business every day from morning until night. She also receives income from her elder sister, who helps her to operate her business. She says at present she is facing the high cost of transportation. 

Fatmata has requested a loan in order to buy more gallons of palm oil for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her child and increase her business. 

In the future, she plans to expand her business more. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy more gallons of palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Haritta

texts.en:
Haritta,  48, lives at Paynesville  South. She is a widow  with  children that are  between  the  ages  of 10 and 28; two of the children live outside the home, and are independent, only her younger child stays with her at home and is in school. 

Haritta has a table  in the market  where  she has been selling sugar, rice, palm oil, Vita, tomatoes, onions, and peppers for the past five  years. Her  children gave her the initial capital  to start up this business.  She is proud of her business because she makes a profit when she sells and is self-reliant. 

Haritta is requesting this loan to purchase more sugar, rice, peppers, onions, tomatoes, and Vita to increase her sales. Her plan is to become an international businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar, rice, peppers, onions, tomatoes, and Vita to increase her sales.

loans.name: Malipo

texts.en:
In the world we live in, people want to set an example for many and seek various activities that will generate income to provide a better future for their children. Malipo who lives with her life companion and three children struggles against her major obstacles, poverty and violence, in order to keep her children from becoming victims of them in the immediate future.

She’s hardworking and enterprising and her greatest wish is to provide her children with a better future; they no doubt will be grateful for it someday. She’s kind, optimistic and always disposed to be better every day.

With much effort she’s succeeded in setting up a food stall which is her source of income. She rises every day with the hope of expanding her little business a bit more to earn the profits she yearns for and above all so that her children should want for nothing. However, she does not have the necessary capital to do so, which is why she approached Yehu to request a loan to buy ingredients like wheat flour and vegetables, among others. She will also buy utensils. She trusts in God that her life will soon have better prospects and to forge a prosperous future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like wheat flour and vegetables, among others, and also buy utensils

loans.name: Kolu

texts.en:
Kolu, age 48, stopped her education in the ninth grade. She is married and lives in Paynesville South. Her husband works for a government entity. She has four boys who are between the ages of 18 and 28. The oldest child lives outside the home and is independent while the other three children stay with her at home and are all college students.  

Kolu has a provision shop where she has been selling biscuits, bath soap, sugar, bread, sardines and lunch meat along with many other items. Because of the location of her shop in the community, she makes a profit when she sells her items. With the profit generated from the business, she pays back her loan and buys more goods for the business.  

She has requested this loan to purchase more sardines, bread, biscuits and bath soap for the business. She hopes to have a big store in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more sardines, bread, biscuits and bath soap for the business.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan Carlos de veintiocho años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida en un hogar humilde, él se dedica a la agricultura y tiene varios años de dedicarse al rubro, su especialidad es cultivar plátano y siempre obtiene las mejores cosechas tambien para complementar los gastos del hogar vende maiz, tiene muchos clientes fijos porque saben que lo que comercia es de muy buena calidad y lo vende a precios accesibles además el servicio es excelente las personas siempre quedan satisfechas; Juan es un hombre emprendedor que siempre aprovecha las oportunidades que se le presentan, piensa que Nuestra actitud hacia la vida determina la actitud de la vida hacia nosotros, por eso quiere trabajar duro para que la vida le regale la felicidad, quiere sembrar un poco más en esta cosecha pero necesita de capital para invertir por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar mata de plátano, fertilizante, insecticida, etc. Juan Carlos tiene capacidad crediticia y muy buenas referencia de pago,  se siente muy contento con la ayuda brindada y además tiene la confianza que podrá con su esfuerzo darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is 28 years old and lives with his life partner in a humble home. He is a farmer and has been working this trade for several years. His specialty is growing plantains and he always obtains the best crops. In order to supplement his income, he also sells corn. He has a stable customer base because his customers know that what he sells is top quality and his prices are affordable. His service is also excellent, so people are always satisfied. 

Juan is an enterprising man who always makes the most of any opportunities that arise. He believes that our attitude toward life determines life's attitude toward us, so he wants to work hard for life to bring him happiness. He wants to plant a bit more this season but he needs capital to invest. That is why he is requesting a loan from Integral, which will allow him to purchase plantain plants, fertilizer, insecticide, etc. Juan Carlos has good credit standing and very good references. He is very happy with the help he is being offered and also trusts that his efforts will allow him to provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase plantain plants, fertilizer, and insecticide.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI  est constitué de quatre femmes  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris, coépouses, frères et fils dans le quartier NIEBALA de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur cinquième prêt. Les quatre précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de friperies et  de céréales.
MARIAM, qui est la présidente du groupe  est position arrêtée derrière les autres membres du groupe. Elle fait l’achat vente le commerce d’articles divers :friperie, savon,  perles de toutes sortes et compte acheter avec son  prêt, 2 colis de friperies  avec les grossistes  de Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25 000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The group BENKADI is composed of four women averaging 37 years of age and three children each. They live in traditional extended families with their husband, co-wives, brothers, and sons in the NIEBALA district of Bougouni City. 

They know one another through ties of community, friendship, and commerce. To bolster their financial capacity, so as to do better in business, they joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their fifth loan. The four previous loans were correctly repaid. This group of women does business in secondhand clothing and grains.

MARIAM, who is the group's president, is the one standing behind the other group members in the photo. She buys and sell a variety of goods: used clothing, soap, and beads of all kinds, and she intends to use her loan to purchase 2 packets of secondhand clothing from Bamako wholesalers. Accepting cash or credit from a customer base composed essentially of women, she makes her sales retail at the market and at home. 

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 25,000 francs CFA that will be invested in her business and used to repay the loan.

loans.use: to purchase secondhand clothing to sell

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Zainab from Kulanda town, Bo, Southern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with three children between the ages of 7 years and 15 years. Two of her children are currently attending school. 

In 1998, Zainab established her plastic rubber slippers business. She began her business after her 0 level exams. There was no one to pay her school fees, and she started to run the business. She works at the business every day, 10 hours a day. At present, she is faced with price inflation and an improper location to keep her business. 

Zainab requires a loan in order to buy more rubber slippers. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and educate her children. 

In the future, she wants her business to expand and she wants to implement another in a different area. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more rubber slippers.

loans.name: Kadija

texts.en:
Meet 27-year-old Kadija from Kulanda town, Bo Southern area in Bo, Sierra Leone. She is married and has two children, ages 2 and 8 years. Her children are currently attending school. In 2005, Kadija established her clothing business. She began her business because she needed to raise income to improve her standard of living. She works at the business every day,10 hours per day. She says that the main challenge to her business is during rainy season, customers have low purchasing power.

Kadija requires a loan in order to buy different kinds of clothing, like jeans, blouses and shirts. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, she plans to build a house. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of clothing, like jeans, blouses and shirts.

loans.name: La Unidad (Flat) Group

texts.es:
Doña Cecilia es miembro de un grupo llamado la unidad el cual esta en la 

comunidad de Tembladeras El Castillo una zona en la que hay muchas 

plantaciones de caña de azúcar, a pocos minutos de distancia del recinto del 

ingenio La Margarita, en el estado de Oaxaca.

Cecilia tiene 45 años, es madre soltera de 2 hijos. Su hija Olga tiene 20 años y está 

casada, y su hijo Jerry tiene 12 años y asiste a la escuela secundaria.

Cecilia tiene un negocio cocinando y vendiendo tacos, hamburguesas y hot-dog. 

Ella cocina la comida al mediodía y por la noche pone un puesto de comida en su 

casa para que  sus clientes vengan ha comer su rica comida. Cecilia empezó este 

negocio hace unos años como una manera de proporcionar una mejor calidad de 

vida para su familia y para brindarle a sus hijos una educación. El negocio ha sido 

un éxito suficiente para cubrir sus necesidades básicas. Cecilia está solicitando un 

préstamo para comprar salchichas, pan, cebolla, ajo, tomate, mayonesa, mostaza, 

carne, tortillas, mantequilla de aceite y gas. Se espera que con esta inversión en 

inventario, su negocio puede tener éxito y sus ingresos puede aumentar así dar a 

su hijo en un futuro la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera.




los demás integrantes del grupo son:

Maria Isabel venta de calzado y ropa
Jose Antonio cría de cerdos
Adriana venta de pollo 
Felipa venta de comida 
claudia cría de cerdos
Evarista venta de mole
texts.en:
Cecilia’s a member of a group called “La Unidad” located in the community of Tembladeras El Castillo where there are many sugarcane fields; it’s just a few minutes away from the La Margarita farming estate in the state of Oaxaca.

Cecilia is 45-years-old and a single mother of two children.  Her daughter, Olga, is 20-years-old and married and her son, Jerry, is 12-years-old and attends secondary school.  Cecilia has a business selling tacos, hamburgers and hot-dogs.  She cooks the food at midday and at night sets up a food stand at home so her customers can come by to enjoy her delicious food.  Cecilia started this business some years ago as a way of providing better quality of life for her family and to provide education for her children.  The business has been sufficiently successful to cover her basic needs.

Cecilia’s requesting a loan to buy sausages, bread, onion, garlic, tomatoes, mayonnaise, mustard, meat, tortillas, margarine and gas.  She hopes that by investing in inventory her business will be successful and her income will increase in order in future to provide her son with the opportunity of studying a career.

The other group members are:

María Isabel - sells clothing and shoes
José Antonio - raises pigs
Adriana - sells chicken 
Felipa - sells food 
Claudia - raises pigs
Evarista - sells mole sauce

loans.use: to buy sausages, bread, onions, garlic, tomatoes, mayonnaise, mustard, meat, tortillas, margarine and gas.

location.town: Tembladeras del castillo, Acatlan de Perez Figuero

loans.name: Cisne Group

texts.es:
Cisne es el nombre de un grupo integrado por 7 personas y esta ubicado una región cañera, su gente se dedica la cultivo y siembra de caña de azúcar, los integrantes de este grupo son: Erika venta de calzado, Elizabet venta de ropa, Maximina venta de ropa, Karen venta de ropa, Lucinda bisutería y papelería, Sabina venta de calzado, cristian servicio de taxi. 

Erika tiene la edad de 25 años, solo estudio la primaria y esta casada, Erika tiene una pequeña bebe de 1 año de edad y platica que hace un poco mas de un año inicio a realizar ventas de zapatos por catalogo con sus amigos y vecinos, ella trabaja por medio de pedidos y sale por las tarde a mostrar sus catálogos amigos y clientes para que hagan sus encargos cuando ya tiene varios pedidos de zapatos se surte y los entrega. ella dijo" yo decidí iniciar a vender zapatos para ganar un poco de dinero y lo que mas me gusta es que realizo mi actividad en mi tiempo libre sin descuidar ni a mi hija ni a mi esposo". ella platica que cuando mas venta tiene es en fechas festivas y en meses de desfiles escolares. Ella invertirá este crédito en la compra de variedad de zapatos y catálogos. Ella espera a futuro poder establecer su negocio en un local para que sus clientes acudan hacerle el gasto y poder mostrar sus productos.
texts.en:
“Cisne” (Swan) is the name of this group consisting of seven people located in a sugar cane region whose residents work growing and planting sugarcane.  The members of this group are: Erika who sells shoes, Elizabet who sells clothes, Maximina who sells clothes, Karen who sells clothes, Lucinda who sells costume jewelry and stationery supplies, Sabina who sells shoes and Cristian who provides taxi service.

Erika, 25, only attended elementary school and she’s married.  She has a one-year-old baby daughter and she relates that a little over a year ago she started selling shoes to her friends and neighbors via catalogue.  She works based on prior orders and goes out afternoons to show her catalogues to her friends and customers so that they can place their orders.  When she has several pending shoe orders she stocks up and fills them.  She said: “I decided to start selling shoes to earn a bit of money and what I like is that I can do my activity in my free time without neglecting my daughter or my husband.”  She relates that when she sells the most is during festive times and in the months when there are school parades.

She will use this loan to buy a variety of shoes and catalogues.  She hopes in future to set up her business in a locale so customers can come by to shop and she can display her products.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
Angélica tiene 47 años, convive con Daniel, el padre de sus 2 hijos de 17 y 15. Ellos viven juntos en una casa propia ubicada en un distrito agrícola. Angélica es una madre ejemplar y una mujer como pocas, pues se dedica a varias actividades. Una de ellas es la agricultura, a la que destina la mayor parte de su tiempo. Desde sus 18 años labra la tierra cultivando productos como papas, habas y arvejas. “Prefiero sembrar papas, porque la variedad que cultivo cuesta más cara que las habas y arvejas”, menciona.
Posee 3 terrenos de cultivos pero en días de mayores siembras arrienda otras parcelas. Al año siembra 2 veces arvejas o habas, pero solo una vez las papas, por eso cuando llegan los meses de siembra se esfuerza mucho para que sus frutos sean como espera. Con el apoyo de su pareja y esposo logra cultivar sus terrenos. Ahora piensa fertilizar sus cultivos de papas, además piensa adquirir semillas de arvejas, por eso solicita de su apoyo una vez más. Éste es su crédito número 2 con MFP, gracias a su ayuda. Se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Siempre Juntos” y está satisfecha con sus logros. Destinará los 2000 soles solicitados en la compra de varias bolsas de abono orgánico para sus cultivos de papas.
texts.en:
Angélica is 47 years old and lives with Daniel, the father of her two children, who are 17 and 15 years old.  They live together in their own home, located in an agricultural region.  Angélica is a wonderful mother and a woman without compare, and she involves herself in various activities.  One of these is farming, to which she gives the majority of her time.  Since she was 18 years old, she has worked the land, cultivating crops like potatoes, broad beans, and field peas.  "I prefer to grow potatoes because the variety that I grow I can sell for more than broad beans or peas," she says.

She has three plots of land under cultivation but at times when she wants to plant more, she rents other plots.  Each year, she seeds her fields two times with field peas or broad beans, but she only plants potatoes once.  Therefore, when the planting times come, she makes a great effort to make sure her harvest will be as she hopes.  With the support of her spouse and partner, she succeeds in planting her fields.  She is now thinking about fertilizing the fields of potatoes, and she also wants to acquire peas for planting, so she is asking for your help once again.

This is her second loan with MFP, thanks to your help.  She promises that she will pay her monthly installments in a timely manner.  She is a member of the communal bank “Siempre Juntos” and has been satisfied with their accomplishments.  She will use the 2000 Soles received to buy several sacks of natural fertilizer for her potato crops.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more gari, groundnuts and palm oil to use in preparing foods to sell.

loans.name: González Comercio Group

texts.es:
Doña Lidia es otro de los integrantes de este grupo, tiene un pequeño negocio en su casa de venta de refrescos, galletas y dulces ya que cruzando la calle esta el campo de futbol lo cual ayuda a tener mas ventas. Ella ya tiene 5 años con su negocio y platica que lo que mas le gusta de su negocio es que gana su dinero sin salir de casa. Doña Lidia comprará variedad de refrescos, frituras, dulces y galletas para resurtir su negocio.

Lidia está casado y tiene siete hijos. Su hija menor se encuentra todavía en la escuela. Con este préstamo, Lidia será capaz de ayudar a financiar la educación de su hija. En el futuro, Lidia espera seguir ampliando su negocio para ayudar a su hija continuar sus estudios.

los demás integrantes del grupo son:
Maria del Socorro venta  de abarrotes
Zeferina venta de antojitos
Fernanda venta de calzado
texts.en:
Doña Lidia is another of the members of this group. She has a little business in her house where she sells soft drinks, crackers, and candies, since the soccer field is across the street from her house, and this helps her have more sales. She has now had this business for five years, and she comments that what she likes most about her business is that she earns money without leaving her house. She will buy a variety of soft drinks, fried snacks, candies, and crackers to stock her business.

Lidia is married and has seven children. Her youngest daughter is still in school. With this loan, Lidia will be able to help pay for the education of her daughter. In the future, Lidia hopes to continue expanding her business to help her daughter continue her studies.

The other members of the group are Maria del Socorro, who sells groceries; Zeferina, who sells snacks; and Fernanda, who sells footwear.

loans.use: to buy a variety of soft drinks, fried snacks, candies, and crackers for her store.

location.town: La Coraza, Acatlan de Perez Figueroa, Oaxaca

loans.name: Sakar's Group

texts.en:
Sakar is 26 years old and an ambitious young Iraqi woman. She is single and has limited career options. Due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Sakar is one of the many Iraqi woman who is working from home, where she uses her sewing skills to generate income.

She has been working at her small home-based business for 3 years and is constantly looking for ways to improve it. She is now hoping to improve her work area and work conditions by buying and installing an A/C unit. She will use this unit to help keep her work room cooler during hot summer days when the temperature reaches as high as 50°Celsius / 122°Fahrenheit. To be able to make this purchase she took a loan from Relief International - Microfinance Iraq. 

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers group loans for clients unable to provide a guarantor - thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of 3 to 5 clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

loans.use: to buy an A/C unit to cool her work room.

loans.name: Hawanatu

texts.en:
Meet 28-year-old Hawanatu from Torkpoi town, Bo Southern, in Sierra Leone. She is married and has two children who are 3 and 6 years old. Her children are currently attending school. In 2007, Hawanatu established her business. She began her business to improve her life and standard of living. She works at the business from morning to night, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are scarcity of goods, and the cost of transporting the goods from the place where she purchases them, to her store.

Hawanatu requires a loan in order to buy more gari, groundnuts and palm oil to resell. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve the welfare of her family. Hawanatu plans to expand her business in the future. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more gari, groundnuts and palm oil to resell.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a 55-year-old, married woman. She and her husband have five children between the ages of 15 and 33 years.

To earn a living, she sells food and fried fish, which is her specialty. She has already been working in this line of business for a number of years. She operates her business out of her home. Despite her advanced age, Mwanakombo explains that she is very responsible.

This will be her first loan from this institution. She would like to use the loan proceeds to buy a freezer. More generally, she is seeking this loan so that she can continue to improve her business. Mwanakombo plans on using her earnings resulting from the loan to continue to buy supplies and to thereby increase her business income.

loans.use: to improve her business of selling food and fried fish, by purchasing a freezer.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Ms. Safia is a 48-year-old married woman. She enjoys her business of weaving rugs and shawls and, with the support of Kashf Foundation, she has built a successful business. Safia has in-depth knowledge of high quality weaving and her daughters help in her work making beautiful rugs and shawls. She earns enough for a hand-to-mouth existence.

She is a loving mother of 3 children and motivated to provide for the family members. Safia has applied for a loan of Rs. 35,000 to buy raw materials such as bundles of wool, threads and various types of cutters and tools to complete the orders on time. Safia expects a boost in her net income through her large sales. She wants to spend part of her income on the expansion of her business, which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: To buy raw materials and tools for her weaving business.

loans.name: Rima

texts.en: Rima is a 37-year-old Lebanese married woman. She lives with her husband and seven children, some of whom are attending school. With the cooperation of her husband, she was able to amplify the family income and satisfy their needs. Rima owns a grocery shop where she sells all kinds of dairy and daily products, in addition to soft drinks and many other products. She is the one who manages her work, and plans to expand her business soon. Her husband also has his own job. He works in floor covering. Today, Rima is asking for a loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase the needed quantity of food provisions for her mini-market. She confirms that by diversifying her items she will be able to increase her revenues and therefore enhance their life conditions. Rima looks forward to better developing her business and waiting for the perfect time to open her own supermarket.

loans.use: to purchase provisions for her mini-market.

loans.name: Mateo

texts.es: Mateo de 44 años, convive con Antonia, la madre de sus 5 hijos. Ellos habitan un hogar propio, que él mismo construyó en un distrito agrícola. Mateo es un hombre perseverante, hace más de 20 años que se dedica a la agricultura. En cada temporada arrienda terrenos para sus cultivos. Pero hace un año adquirió un terreno propio (uno de sus logros y por lo que se siente contento), ahí también cultiva hortalizas. Uno de los problemas que siempre ha afrontado es el cambio climático de la zona, por el intenso frío y las lluvias. “A pesar del frío las lluvias son beneficiosas, estos meses empiezan las siembras grandes gracias a las lluvias”, menciona optimista. Con la ayuda de su esposa y 2 de sus hijos mayores, cultiva sus productos con alegría, pues le gusta su trabajo. Las satisfacciones vienen cuando recibe el dinero producto de sus ventas en el mercado mayorista de Tarma. Sus metas próximas son terminar con esta temporada de siembras de octubre y noviembre, para ello requiere de su apoyo para adquirir fertilizantes orgánicos y semillas. Con este crédito, serían 9 veces que Mateo trabaja con MFP. Su banco comunal se llama “Nueva Jerusalén” y se siente a gusto con sus compañeros por ser tan puntuales en sus pagos y ahorros. Mateo invertirá el dinero en la compra de abono orgánico para sus cultivos de papas, además comprará una bolsa de semillas de arvejas.
texts.en: Mateo, who is 44 years old, lives with Antonia, the mother of their five children. They live in their own house, which he built himself in an agricultural district. Mateo is a man with perseverance. He has worked in agriculture for more than 20 years. Each season he leases land for his crops, but a year ago he acquired a plot of land of his own (one of his achievements and for which he feels pleased). There he also grows vegetables. One of the problems that he has always faced is the climatic change in the area, because of the intense cold and the rains. "In spite of the cold, the rains are beneficial. In these months the big plantings begin, thanks to the rains," he mentions optimistically. With the help of his wife and two of their older children, he grows his products with happiness, because he likes his work. The satisfaction comes when he receives the money produced by his sales in the wholesale market of Tarma. His next goals are to finish this October and November planting season; for that he needs your support to acquire organic fertilizers and seeds. With this loan, it will be the ninth time that Mateo has worked with MFP. His communal bank is called "Nueva Jerusalén" (New Jerusalem), and he feels at ease with his fellow bank members because he is punctual in his payments and savings. Mateo will invest the money in the purchase of organic fertilizer for his crops of potatoes, and he will also buy a bag of seeds for peas.

loans.use: to buy bags of organic fertilizer and seeds for peas

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Mariama from Torkpoi town, Bo Southern area, in Sierra Leone. She is a married mother of one child, aged 13 years. She began her business to have a permanent source of income.

Mariama runs a palm oil business; she sells palm oil around her neighborhood. She has been running this business for 10 years. She works at the business every day, 12 hours per day. Her husband is a driver; Mariama receives income from him and other relatives. She says her major business problem is the high rate of theft.

Mariama has requested a loan in order to buy more gallons of palm oil to resell. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her child and improve her level of income. She plans to expand her business to a store level in the future.

loans.use: to buy more gallons of palm oil to resell.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 26-year-old Joyce, from Torkpoi town, Bo Southern area. She is married and has no child, for now.  She has two relatives that she takes care of at home. 

Joyce runs a clothing business within her environment. She sells traditional pattern and design cloth. She has been running this business for 7 years. She works at the business every day, 6 days per week. Her business is the only source of income she has. Joyce says that the main challenge to her business is that sometimes customers refuses to pay her, after she provides goods on credit. 

Joyce has requested a loan in order to prepare more tie dye fabric for her to sell. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and start a savings account. In the future, she plans to open a clothing store. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to prepare more tie dye fabric to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Gemma

texts.en: Ma. Gemma is a 46-year-old, married woman from Panglao, Bohol. She has three children. The oldest child is 19, while the youngest is 7 years old. She raises hogs. She has been in the hog-raising business for almost one year. She earns 7,000 a month by raising hogs. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP, to buy additional piglets and kinds of feed, like hog booster, and hog finisher pellets. Ma. Gemma would like to expand her business in the future, by investing in other ventures to support her family, as well as to finance the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and kinds of feed

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.en: Bernardina is a 53-year-old, married woman from Panglao, Bohol. She is the mother of a twenty-year-old daughter. She owns a sari-sari (variety) store. She has been in the sari-sari store business for eleven years. She sells commodities like shampoo, soy sauce, vinegar, canned good, eggs, rice and soft drinks. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional merchandise to sell, like soft drinks, rice and canned goods. Bernardina would like to improve her business by investing in other ventures to support the family's needs.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like soft drinks, rice, and canned goods, to resell in her store.

loans.name: Jerlyn

texts.en: Jerlyn is a 30-year-old, married woman from Panglao, Bohol. She has four children. The oldest child is 9, while the youngest is 4 years old. She is a fish vendor. She sells fish. She has been in the fish vending business for almost one year. She requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase more fish to sell, and styrofoam containers used for cool fish storage. Jerlyn would like to improve her business, in order to support her family and to be able to completely repair their house.

loans.use: to buy fish, and styrofoam containers for cool fish storage.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
From a very young age, Lorena witnessed firsthand what it means to run a small business through helping with the day-to-day activities of running her family’s restaurant in Sinaloa, Mexico.  Lorena caught the entrepreneurial spirit through these early experiences and she decided she would someday follow in her parents' footsteps.

Four years ago, money was tight for this single mother and she began to sell personal belongings at yard sales and swap-meets to supplement her income and support her family.  She soon realized that she had a natural ability in sales and would quickly sell out of her daily inventory.  Her friends took notice of her sales abilities and began to ask her to sell their stuff as well.  

Lorena’s discovered love for retail led her to open her own business selling clothing and accessories at local swap meets.  Her new business is giving Lorena the opportunity she needs to better provide for her kids and create a better future for them.  

Though Lorena’s business is growing, she lacks the capital to purchase more quality inventory.  Lorena will use her $3,200 Kiva loan to purchase much needed inventory in time for the holiday season.  She dreams of someday growing her business to the point where she can move into a storefront boutique.

loans.use: to purchase inventory in time for the holiday season

loans.name: Venancia

texts.en:
Venancia is a 58-year-old married woman from Panglao, Bohol. She has four children. The oldest child is twenty-two while the youngest is sixteen. Venancia is engaged in the house-for-rent business. She has been in the house-for-rent business for  seven years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy paint and a toilet bowl.

In the future, Venancia would like to invest in other ventures to support her family as well as to save for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy items like paint and a toilet bowl

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en:
Altantsetseg is 40 years old and lives with her mother and brother in her old wooden house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. She has worked as an assistant doctor in the emergency service of the 4th power plant of Ulaanbaatar since 1997. Her brother works as a knitter in a private cashmere company. And her mother is a pensioner. 

Altantsetseg said that her father built the house when she was 7 and many pleasant memories relating to her childhood and family are kept in this house. So she loves her house. But now, due its old age, her house is in incredibly bad condition. Last year she had to burn a large amount of coal to warm the house to overcome the winter. So, before the winter she has planned to build a new winter house, using energy-saving materials like foam, glass-wool, double-glazed windows and bricks. 

Now she is bricking up the walls. After this part, she needs to make the roof, insulate the walls on both sides and to install the windows. Altantsetseg is requesting 2,000,000 MNT loan to buy energy-saving materials for her new house construction in order to cut the usage of coal and to contribute her effort to save the environment.

loans.use: to buy energy-saving materials for her house construction

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
Félix tiene 44 años de edad, hace 20 años se casó con Nancy, con quien tiene 7 hijos, pero solo vive con 3 de ellos,  siendo su hija menor de 3 años. Toda ésta familia habita en una casa rústica de su propiedad. Félix es un hombre trabajador y responsable. Desde que se casó se dedica con esmero a la agricultura. Él cuenta con terrenos agrícolas que su comunidad le otorgó, en esas parcelas siembra papas de distintas variedades, arvejas, habas y verduras, tales como: zanahorias, lechugas, coles, entre otras. Pero considera que es más rentable sembrar arvejas y papas, por la demanda que tienen y por las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas.  “Empecé sembrando 2 parcelas, ahora aumenté mi producción a 5, y produzco más de un fruto”, menciona orgulloso.
Sus hijos mayores ahora ya son independientes, por eso contrata personal para cosechar y cultivar. Ahora desea adquirir bolsas de abono orgánico para iniciar una siembra de papas, por ello solicita de su apoyo. Con éste serían 10 préstamos con MFP. Menciona que será puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva Jerusalén” y se siente a gusto trabajando en equipo.
Invertirá los 2500 soles solicitados en la compra de 20 bolsas de abono orgánico para sus futuros sembríos de papas.
texts.en:
Félix is 44 years old and has been married to Nancy for twenty years. They have seven children together, but only three live with them, their youngest daughter being three years old. This family all live in the rustic house they own. Félix is a hard worker and a responsible man. Ever since he got married he has worked with dedication as a farmer. He has the farmland his community gave him and on that land he grows several varieties of potatoes, peas, fava beans, and vegetables like carrots, lettuce, cabbage, and others. However, he considers it more profitable to grow peas and potatoes because of the high demand there is for these products and the profit he obtains by selling them. 

"I started out farming two plots of land, and now my production has increased to five," he says proudly. His older children are now independent, so he hires workers to harvest and farm the land. Now he wants to purchase bags of organic fertilizer to start planting potatoes, which is why he is requesting help. This will be his 10th loan with MFP. He says he will pay his monthly installments on time. He belongs to the communal bank Nueva Jerusalén and feels comfortable working as a team. He will invest the requested 2,500 soles in the purchase of twenty bags of organic fertilizer for his future potato crops.

loans.use: to purchase twenty bags of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Gregory

texts.en:
Gregory is an established author of the acclaimed book, “Help!!! (Help Me, Help You, Help Us).  He founded Help Enterprises (HEP) in 2009, focusing on assisting individuals in developing a relationship within themselves and with others. His new book “HELP! Motivation for the Mind, Body and Soul” is set for release in 2013.  

Gregory is seeking a $7,500 loan to fund inventory, equipment and fees to expand his product line at the multimedia publishing company of motivational books and other related products.

loans.use: To fund inventory and pay for equipment and fees to expand his product line

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en:
Zainabu, 33, is divorced and lives with her three children in Msambweni, a neighborhood located in the south coast of Kenya. 

Thanks to her entrepreneurial spirit which she inherited from her mother, she set up her own fast-food business two years ago where she spends ten hours a day, Monday through Sunday. She will use the loan to buy ingredients like corn flour, wheat flour, and cooking oil, among others. She is very sure to increase her income so she can give her children quality education.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like corn flour, wheat flour, and cooking oil, among others.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam has had success and failure, but even so the desire to get ahead has always been one if this young woman's biggest dreams. She lives with her family and sells fruits and vegetables. She has been doing this for some time and it has given her valuable experience in sales, allowing her to obtain better earnings. She is well known to the people in the area and has a lot of customers who prefer the quality of her products, the good prices and the excellent service. 

Mariam is a woman with a lot of potential who is decisive and dedicated to her work. Every day she fights to have a better future. She is happy with her work and doesn't want to disappoint her family. In the last few weeks demand has increased and she needs to make a new investment. That is why she is asking for a loan that will allow her to buy tomatoes, potatoes, cabbages, kale, etc.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, potatoes, cabbages, kale, etc.

loans.name: Juan Rafael

texts.es:
Juan, de 47 años de edad, originario de Telica municipio de León,   padre de 5 hijos todos viven independientes, el creció sin ningún nivel escolar. La mayor parte de su vida la ha dedicado a trabajar en las labores del campo, su padre desde pequeño lo llevo a trabajar en las siembra y  crianzas de animales, fue lo único que aprendió. De esta manera mantuvo a sus hijos y solvento los gastos del hogar, el recuerda que su primer cultivo fue el algodón cuando tenía 11 años de edad.   
Está solicitando un crédito para comprar insumos, fertilizantes y pagar mano de obra para darle un mejor  mantenimiento a sus cultivos. Pues su idea es ir ampliando sus áreas de siembra y poner una pulpería pues en su comunidad no hay muchas y son de necesidad entre la población.
texts.en:
47-year-old Juan comes from Telica, in the town of León. He has five children, all of whom are independent. He grew up with no schooling whatsoever. He has spent most of his life working in farming. Ever since he was young, his father took him to work in raising animals and sowing, and that's all he learned. That's the way he supported his children and paid for his household's expenses. He recalls that his first crop was cotton when he was 11 years old.
He's requesting a loan in order to purchase supplies and fertilizers, and to pay for labor so that he can better maintain his crops. His idea is to gradually expand his sowing area and to set up a grocery store, because there aren't many of them in his village and there is need for them among the population.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and fertilizers, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Tunu

texts.en:
A desire for self-improvement is one of the most important goals for this woman who lives with her family in their own house in the town of Msambweni. She sells fish in a very strategic sales point at the market. She goes to the fishermen every morning to get her stock. She is a very hard-working, dedicated person with many goals to be met.

She is working hard to have a more prosperous future and is happy with her business, but knows she must expand to earn more. Lately, she has noticed an increase in demand and wants to make a larger investment to buy more merchandise. Therefore she is requesting a loan to buy more stock of fish, a frying pan, and a freezer. She is satisfied with this support, knowing that she is going to pay back the loan on time. She is also confident she will be able to provide her household with the lifestyle the family deserves.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish, a frying pan, and a freezer.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is 22 years old. She is a divorced woman who lives with two minor children in the town of Msambweni.

For three years, Mwanasha has been selling merchandise door-to-door, and by orders. She sells new and used clothing, as well as vegetables and coconuts.

This is her first loan with Yehu, needed to keep her business brisk. This loan is for 10,000 KES (Kenyan shillings). She will spend it on the purchase of a bundle of clothing in order to always maintain an inventory and to be able to open a new market.

Her plans are to increase her sales, eventually have a clothing store and provide her children with a better life.

loans.use: to purchase of a bundle of clothing.

loans.name: Mario Alberto

texts.es: Mario Alberto junto a su hija, su hermano, y su madre en casa propia, él se dedica a la venta de ganado y adicional a esto para completar los gastos del hogar a la venta de leche y maricos, ya tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura lo que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, el terreno donde se ubican las vacas es amplio con gran incidencia agrícola y esta cercano a su vivienda, el producto lo comercializa en los alrededores de la comunidad y se ha hecho de mucha clientela que lo prefiere por la calidad, los buenos precios y sobre todo por el excelente servicio; Mario es un hombre emprendedor, amable y servicial siempre esta a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que le permitan alcanzar el éxito, en la ultima temporada tuvo algunas perdidas y quiere recuperarse por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un credito que le permita comprar ganado. Mario Alberto tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable, se siente feliz por la ayuda, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía que le dara a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mario Alberto lives with his daughter, brother and mother in their own house. He makes a living selling livestock as well as milik and fish to cover the household expenses. He has worked in agriculture for several years allowing him to make more money. The land where the cows are located is wide and which is largely agricultural and is close to his home. He sells his products in the surrounding areas of his community and has many customers that prefer him for his quality, good prices and above all, excellent service. 

Mario is an entrepreneurial, friendly and accomodating man. He is always in search of new opportunities for him to reach success. Last season he had some losses and wants to recuperate. For this reason he is requesting a loan from Integral that will help him to buy livestock. Mario Alberto has good payment references and is very responsible. He is happy to receive this help and assures that he will be able to pay the debt and at the same time is confident that he will give his family a better quality life.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Gloria Estela

texts.es:
La  Señora Gloria, de 38 años, vive con su conyugue y sus 2 hijos en su casa de habitación en la comunidad del Guayabo Nacaome, en la zona sur de Honduras, Ella se dedica desde hace 9 años a la venta de productos alimenticios, como es la venta de pollo, carnes, embutidos, lácteos, y productos de abarrotería como jabón, sardinas, papel de baño, en su negocio esta ubicado en su casa, sus clientes son los vecinos y amigos que a diario le visitan, le prefieren por su amabilidad y su buen trato.
Doña Gloria esta solicitando 10,000.00 lempiras para compra de frescos, churros, pastas, verduras, lácteos, granos básicos, carnes, pollo, embutidos y otros productos. Con el apoyo del préstamo ella pretende suplir la necesidad de financiamiento para su negocio y  de igual forma mejorar sus ingresos.
Doña Gloria su sueño es mejorar más su negocio y ampliar su casa de habitación.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Octubre del 2012.
texts.en:
Gloria, 38 years old, lives with her partner and her 2 children in her house in the community of Guayabo Nacaome in the southern part of Honduras. For 9 years, she has sold food products such as chicken, meat, sausages, milk products, and groceries such as soap, sardines, toilet paper, etc., at her business located in her house. Her customers are her neighbors and friends who visit her daily. They prefer her because she is friendly and treats them well. 

Gloria is asking for 10,000.00 lempiras to buy juice, churros, pasta, vegetables, milk products, staple grains, meat, chicken, sausages, and other products. With the help of the loan, she intends to provide the necessary financing for her business and also improve her income. 

Gloria's dream is to further improve her business and expand her house. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - October 2012.

loans.use: to buy juice, churros, pasta, vegetables, milk products, staple grains, meat, chicken, sausages, and other products for her business

loans.name: Dolores Armida

texts.es: Dolores Arminda vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos; Ella se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de maíz tiene varios años de trabajar en el rubro  y ha ganado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, el terreno donde cultiva es de alta incidencia agrícola y esta muy cercano a su vivienda muy accesible para trabajar, comercia en todos los alrededores de la comunidad y ya tiene mucha clientela que la prefiere porque siempre posee lo que necesitan, con producto de calidad, a precios accesibles pero sobre todo con un excelente servicio; Dolores es una mujer dedicada a su labor, enérgica y luchadora, todos los días se levanta dispuesta a lograr sus objetivos, se esfuerza al máximo pues sabe que así alcanzara el éxito que desea, en la ultima temporada de siembra no pudo obtener las ganancias esperadas por eso en este periodo de siembra quiere recuperarse y realizar una nueva inversión para ello le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, insecticida, herbicida, herramienta, etc. Dolores tiene buenas referencias de pago asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Dolores Arminda lives with her life partner and her children. She works in agriculture, specifically growing corn. She's been in this line of work for several years and has gotten a lot of experience, which allows her to obtain the best crops. The plot of land where she sows is located in a highly agricultural area that's very close to her home, with easy access to her work. She makes her sales in all the neighboring areas and she has already gotten a lot of customers. Her customers prefer to go to her because she always has what they need - high quality produce at accessible prices, and most of all with good service. Dolores is a woman who's dedicated to her work, energetic and a real fighter. She wakes up every day willing to accomplish her goals. She works as hard as she can because she knows that by doing that she'll achieve the success she wishes for. In the last harvest season she wasn't able to obtain the profits she had hoped for, so on this sowing season she wants to recover and make a new investment. For that reason she requests a loan from INTEGRAL so that she can purchase corn seeds, insecticide, herbicide, tools, etc. Dolores has a good credit record and she guarantees that she'll be able to repay the debt. At the same time, she believes that she'll improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase corn seeds, insecticide, herbicide and tools.

loans.name: Benito Juarez Group

texts.es:
Benito Juarez es el nombre de un grupo integrado por 5 personas cada una de ellas tiene una actividad económica Jazmín venta de abarrotes, Agustina venta de lencería, Maria Dora venta de cosméticos, Ceferina venta de ropa, Cándido venta de carne. Este grupo esta ubicado en una región cañera y su principal fuentes de empleo es el campo en la siembra de caña de azúcar.

Jazmín es una joven de 24 años, solo estudio la secundaria y esta casada con Antonio que trabaja como Maestro y tienen dos pequeños hijos,Jazmín platica que hace más de 9 años con el apoyo de su esposo  abrieron un tienda de abarrotes en su hogar con la intención de ganar un poco de dinero extra, tiempo después construyeron un local en la parte de enfrente de su casa para ahí ubicar su negocio.

Con un préstamo de Fundación Realidad, Jazmín podrá comprar frijol, arroz, atún, sopa, aceite, variedad de galletas, jabón, cloro, refrescos, productos en latados, papel de baño, pasta dental y dulces para resurtir su negocio. 

Los desafíos que ella enfrenta en su negocio es cuando termina la zafra(cuando el ingenio entra en reparación) ya que sus ventas disminuyen.

Ella desea que con este préstamo su negocio continúe creciendo ya que quiere que sus hijos tengan la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Benito Juarez is the name of a group that is formed by five members. Each of them is dedicated to a different economic activity. Jazmín has a general store, Agustina sells underwear, Maria Dora sells cosmetics, Ceferina sells clothes and Cándido sells meat. The group is located in a sugarcane region where the main source of employment is agriculture. 
Jazmín is a young woman, age 24 who only studied through middle school.  She is married to Antonio, who works as a teacher and they are the parents of two young children. Jazmín says that 9 years ago, she and her husband opened a general store with the intention to earn some extra money. After being in business for a while they built a storefront in their home to locate their business there.
With the funds of the Fundación Realidad loan, Jazmín will be able to purchase beans, rice, canned tuna, cooking oil, cookie assortment, soap, chlorine, drinks, canned goods, toilette paper, toothpaste and candy to stock her business.
Jazmin faces challenges in her business at the end of the seasonal labor of the harvest time, because her sales diminish.
She wishes this loan can help her business to keep on growing, because she wants to offer her children the opportunity to study a career.

loans.use: to purchase beans, rice, canned tuna, cooking oil, cookie assortment, soap, chlorine, drinks, canned goods, toilette paper, toothpaste and candy to stock her business

loans.name: Purita

texts.en:
Purita is 39 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Purita is borrowing 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Purita has been farming rice for eight years and also earns additional income from fish vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Minjin

texts.en: Mrs. Minjin is 42 years old and lives with her husband and 4 children in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in the Arkhangai province of Mongolia. Her husband is a security guard at a private company. Her oldest son is a university student and  her 3 daughters are secondary school students. Currently she is working at a private tailoring company as a tailor. She has years of experience in this area and has already built close relationships with customers. Her income is performance based and she needs to pay her son's university tuition fee and living expenses in the capital city. She is an open-minded and diligent person. She is requesting a 600,000 MNT loan to pay her son's university tuition fee and other expenses related to his education.

loans.use: to pay her son's university tuition fee and other expenses related to his education.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie, a 44-year-old married mother of five, has been earning a living by farming rice in the Philippines for the past eight years. She earns additional income by farming coconuts, selling dried coconut meat.
