loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 37 years old and married to Njenga. She is blessed with three children aged 10, 15, and 20 years. She operates a timber yard and has been running this business for 10 years. She earns a monthly income of KES 45,000.

She has borrowed a third loan of KES 100,000 from KADET LTD with which she intends to purchase more timber for resale. She also plans to use the funds for the expansion of the yard. The anticipated profit will be used to pay school fees for her school-going children.

Her dreams are to improve her living standards and to own her own residential plot.

loans.use: to expand her timber yard.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Sokha is 45 years old. She is married with four children and lives with her family in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been in the agricultural field for more than twenty years, and is experienced and successful in her business. She is involved in animal husbandry, fishing, and growing rice. She earns about $8 daily. Her husband helps her run the business. Two of her children are employed in Korea; they earn about $50 per day. 

Sokha is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase rice seeds to use for farming in the dry season. This money will help her maintain enough capital to operate her farming business. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children achieve a higher level of education. Moreover, she plans to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds to use for farming in the dry season

loans.name: Sarun

texts.en:
Sarun is 37 years old. She is widowed and resides with her five children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been employed as a road construction worker for more than three years, earning approximately $3 per day. Four of her children are employed; they earn about $7 per day. 

Sarun is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase construction materials to build a toilet and bathroom. This money will help her provide hygienic living conditions for her family. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store to generate additional income for the family, and build a new house if possible.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build a toilet and bathroom

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Thy is 45 years old. She is married with two children and lives with her family in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been selling clothes for more than nine years, earning approximately $9 daily. Her husband is involved in cultivating rubber plants; he earns about $28 each day. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Thy is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase farmland to use for cultivating more rubber plants. This money will help her expand the business and earn more income to support her family. In the future she would like to expand her farmland and build a new, bigger house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase farmland for cultivating rubber plants

loans.name: Dorine

texts.en:
Dorine is 29 years old, married to Amos, and blessed with a three-year-old child. She runs an M-Pesa shop, a business she ventured into three years ago. She earns a monthly income of KES 20,000. 

She has requested a second loan of KES 60,000 to purchase both Safaricom and Airtel credit cards, as well as to add float to her M-Pesa business. 

The profit she earns from this business will help her open another branch. Her dream is to see her business prosper and to become a millionaire someday.

loans.use: To purchase both Safaricom and Airtel credit cards and to add float to her M-pesa business.

loans.name: Emerita

texts.es:
Emerita, de 46 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de Raúl su esposo desde hace 26 años. Ambos tienen 4 hijos, de los cuales solo 2 viven con ellos: Anderson y Jefferson a los que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Paccha. Toda su vida ha estado ligada a la agricultura y la ganadería que hoy es su fuente de ingresos, cuando formo una familia a la lado de su esposo, decidieron intensificar esta actividad sembrando principalmente  papa y habas en gran cantidad. Además de pastizales para su ganado en diferentes terrenos de cultivo de los que han heredado ella y su esposo. La agricultura  es una actividad que le gusta mucho y disfruta de realizarla porque siempre está en contacto con el campo y la naturaleza y le trae mucha tranquilidad. Pero como ella es una mujer trabajadora, todas las mañanas saca a sus animales entre toros, vacas y ovejas para que puedan alimentarse, cuenta que desea realizar queso, pero todavía no cuenta con muchas vacas lecheras, pero lo que si realiza es el arado de la tierra con los toros que posee, “de esa manera ahorro la preparación de terreno por otras personas”, comenta. Muy pronto comprará más ovejas, con la ayuda de su esposo quien trabaja en una mina. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “productoras agrícolas las emprendedoras” y este es el octavo crédito con MFP, agradece el apoyo financiero que le otorgan de manera constante. Ahora tiene el medio para mejorar su negocio. Promete ser puntual con sus cuotas, ya que le enseñaron a ser responsable.
Emerita, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 2 toros de raza para aumentar su ganado.
texts.en:
Emerita, age 46, is a hardworking woman. She has lived with her husband Raúl for 26 years and they have four children. Two of them, Anderson and Jefferson, still live with them in their own home in the town of Paccha. Emerita has spent her entire life around farming and ranching, and now she makes her living in this manner. When she and her husband started their family, they decided to intensify their farming activity by planting mostly potatoes and beans in great quantity. Their cattle graze on different plots of land that she and her husband inherited. Farming is an activity she enjoys very much because it always keeps her in touch with the earth and with nature, which gives her great peace. Being hardworking woman, Emerita spends every morning letting her animals (bulls, cows, and sheep) out to pasture so that they can graze. She would like to start producing cheese, but she does not have very many dairy cows. However, she is able to plow her farmland with her existing bulls. “This keeps me from having to pay other people to prepare the land,” says Emerita. She will buy more sheep very soon, with the help of her husband who works at a mine.

Emerita is a member of the solidarity group “Productoras Agrícolas Las Emprendedoras”. This is her eighth loan with MFP and she is grateful for the financial support that has been provided to her in a constant manner. She now has the means to improve her business and promises to be punctual with her payments, thus demonstrating that she will be responsible. Emerita will invest the money she requested in the purchase of two pedigree bulls so that she can increase her herd of cattle.

loans.use: to buy two pedigree bulls.

loans.name: Manne Du Ciel Group

texts.fr: La cliente Nyanchira, est un entrepreneur dynamique, âgée d’environ 48 ans, mariée, mère de 6 enfants et plusieurs autres enfants sous tutelle, qui étudient tous. Son mari est un vendeur de valise. Quant à la cliente, elle fait le commerce général. Environs 15 ans, elle exerce ces petites activités économiques. Elle commença avec un faible capital reçu de son mari, plus tard, elle adhéra dans un groupe élémentaire dit banque communautaire de Hekima. Aujourd’hui, elle est intégrée dans le groupe d’affaire  très restreint  dit « Manne du ciel », qui bénéficie de montant de crédit un peu plus significatif avec une large échéance. Ce nouveau prêt  doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec  2 casiers de Fanta, 2 fus d’huile, les savons, Primus, riz, etc. En plus, elle souhaite voir ses enfants grandir, accroitre son unité d’exploitation et construire une galerie commerciale. La cliente remercie Hekima pour ses actions d’autonomisation en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en:
Nyanchira, the featured borrower, is a dynamic entrepreneur who is about 48 years old, married, and the mother of six children.  She is also the guardian of several other children.  All her children attend school.  Her husband sells suitcases.

Nyanchira sells various grocery products and has been involved in this type of commercial activity for the past fifteen years or so.  She started her business using a small capital received from her husband.  Later on, she joined Hekima's basic community bank program.  Today, she is a member of the very small solidarity group "Manne du ciel" which provides slightly higher loan amounts and a longer repayment term.

She will use this new loan to buy two crates of Fanta, two barrels of oil, some soap, Primus (beer), rice etc.

Nyanchira wants to see her children grow up.  She would also like to increase the size of her business and build a small shopping center.  She thanks Hekima for empowering low-income women excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to buy two crates of Fanta, two barrels of oil, some soap, Primus (beer), rice etc...

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.en: Dilafruz is 19 years old. She is not married and lives with her parents. She has always dreamed of being a successful business lady. Some years ago she began her activity as a shop assistant. Also, Dilafruz sews very beautiful women’s dresses. She decided to start a new business of selling women’s clothes, in order to generate an income with which she can contribute to her home’s finances. She studied by taking the course, "To Get Ahead," of a women's organization, and she got enough skills about business. She will be a very successful business woman, because she is hard-working and smart. She is asking for a loan of 2500 USD to buy women’s clothes for organizing her new business. By using the loan, she will make her business become a source of income, so that her family can have a good quality of life and better opportunities to progress, financially. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy women’s clothes for organizing a new business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy clothes, fabrics and embroidery materials, for her boutique business.

loans.name: Rogie

texts.en:
Rogie grows rice crops within his village. He has been running his rice field for five years. He is thankful, because his previous loan helped him so much, most especially in the development of his rice field and improvement of his financial stability.

Rogie would like to have continuous growth of his rice farming business. Therefore, he is seeking a loan of 20,000 PHP. He will use this amount to buy farm inputs, such as fertilizer and certified seed, and pay for preparation of his rice farm land for planting. He hopes for approval of his loan, so he could have a stable source of income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs, such as fertilizer and certified seed, and pay for preparation of his rice farm land for planting.

loans.name: Rodolfo Alejandro

texts.es:
El señor  Rodolfo,  se dedica a su negocio de Prestación de servicios de transporte taxi, desde hace ocho meses, se encuentra ubicado en un punto muy bueno ya que esta asignado a un punto de taxis de un Mall de la Ciudad,  contando también con mucho clientes que lo llaman para solicitarle sus servicios lo prefieren por su buena atención.
Don Rodolfo esta solicitando crédito por valor de L. 15,000.00 para reparación y mantenimiento de uno de su vehículo ya que le esta dando problemas y el quiere tenerlo en optimas condiciones para prestar un servicio de calidad.
Don Rodolfo desea que su negocio le ayude a mantener a su familia y darles una mejor calidad de vida.

Tegucigalpa, Honduras – Octubre 2012
texts.en:
Sr. Rodolfo has been providing taxi services for eight months. He is located in a very good area and has been assigned a taxi stop at a mall in the city. Rodolfo has many customers who call on him to request his services. They prefer to do business with him because he provides them a great deal of attention.

Don Rodolfo is requesting a loan in the amount of 15,000 HNL so that he can repair and maintain one of his vehicles that has been experiencing problems. He wants to keep it in optimal condition so that he can provide quality service. Don Rodolfo wants his business to provide the means of supporting his family and giving them a better quality of life.

Tegucigalpa, Honduras – October 2012

loans.use: to buy spare parts and lubricants so that he can repair and maintain his taxi.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
María, una humilde campesina, habitante de la comarca La Ceiba ubicada en las afueras de León. Gracia a  su primer crédito Kiva logro comprar comida para sus animales y criarlos de manera saludable lo que a su vez le permitió vender los cerditos a un buen precio, se siente muy orgullosa de los logro y de haber cancelado su crédito a tiempo, esto le impulso a seguir mejorando y lograr tener una granja de cerdos reproductores y tener mejores condiciones de vida. 
Está solicitando este financiamiento para comprar cerdos reproductores.
texts.en:
María is a humble country dweller. She resides in the region of La Ceiba, which is located on the outskirts of León. Thanks to her first Kiva loan, she was able to buy animals and raise them in a healthy manner. Eventually she was able to sell the piglets at a good price.

María is very proud of what she has achieved and that she was able to repay her loan on time. This encouraged her to continue improving so that she could have a pig breeding farm and better living conditions.

She is requesting this loan so that she can buy pigs for breeding.

loans.use: to buy pigs for breeding.

loans.name: Kim Heng

texts.en:
Kim Heng is 27 years old. She is married with two children and lives with her family in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been selling fish for more than ten years, earning approximately $10 daily. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about $5 each day. 

In order to improve her business, Kim Heng is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase more fish to sell. This money will help her expand her business and earn more income for the family. In the future, she would like to use her profits to expand the business further and help her children earn their bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Loeurn

texts.en:
Loeurn is 23 years old. She is married with three children and lives with her family in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice and fattening animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $2 daily. Her husband is employed in a hotel, and earns about $7 per day. 

Loeurn is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase zinc and timber to fix part of her house. This money will help improve her living conditions. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children get a higher education.

loans.use: to purchase zinc and timber to fix part of her house

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a 40-year-old married lady. She is blessed with four children aged 20, 17, 14 and 11. She has been operating a green grocer’s for six years, earning a monthly income of KES 18,000. She has borrowed her first loan of KES 20,000 from KADET LTD, with which she intends to purchase more fruits and vegetables for resale. The anticipated profits will be used to pay her children’s school fees. Her dreams are to improve her standard of living and own her own residential plot.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Gervas

texts.en: Gervas is a 31-year-old man who is married with three children. He has been in the motorcycle transport business for six years now and earns a monthly income of four thousand shillings. This will be his second loan with KADET LTD, and he plans to use the entire loan to purchase spare parts for his motorcycle. In the future he wants to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts

loans.name: Kepha

texts.en: Kepha is 30 years old and supports a family of four people. He makes and distributes baked bread and donuts. He has been running the business for the past four years, earning a monthly income of KES 20,000. He has borrowed his first loan of KES 20,000 from KADET LTD with which he intends to purchase a bicycle to assist in the distribution process. The anticipated profits will be reinvested to boost the business. His future dream is to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase a bicycle to transport his products

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es: Lourdes, de 46 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de sus dos hijas, Hely y Emili a las que cuida en su casa propia. Toda su vida ha estado ligada a la agricultura y la ganadería que hoy es su fuente de ingresos, cuando formó una familia al lado del que fue su esposo, hace 20 años. Decidió intensificar esta actividad sembrando principalmente  la papa, maíz, habas, trigo, cebada y pastizales para que consuma su ganado en diferentes terrenos de cultivo. En la actualidad sigue cultivando y le generan las ganancias necesarias para seguir adelante. Además de poseer vacas, a las que le saca mucho provecho, ya que realiza queso con la leche que produce, según cuenta cada mañana en cuestión de horas, se termina los moldes que prepara, ya que los profesores y enfermeras son sus principales clientes. Con su familia se ha propuesto mejorar cada año y superar su producción ganadera y agrícola, ya que su secreto es comercializar los alimentos a la capital del país, en donde cada vez la competencia en muy fuerte. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “productoras agrícolas las emprendedoras” y este es el sexto crédito con MFP, agradece el apoyo financiero que le otorgan de manera constante. Ahora tiene el medio para mejorar su negocio. Promete ser puntual con sus cuotas, ya que le enseñaron a ser responsable. Lourdes, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico para distribuir entre sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Lourdes, age 46, is a hardworking woman. She lives with her two daughters, Hely and Emili, and cares for them in her own home. Lourdes has spent her entire life around farming and ranching, and now it is the means by which she is able to generate income. When she and her husband started their family 20 years ago, they decided to intensify their farming activity by growing mostly potatoes, corn, beans, wheat, barley, and fodder for their cows that roam on different plots of land. At the moment, Lourdes continues to farm and is able to generate the necessary income to move forward. She also owns cows and takes full advantage of them by making cheese from the milk that they produce. Lourdes says that every morning, she is able to finish producing cheese molds within a matter of hours. Her main customers are teachers and nurses. Along with her family, she proposes to improve each year and exceed their previous livestock and farming production. Her secret is to sell her products in the capital, where the level of competition gets stronger each time.

Lourdes is a member of the solidarity group “Productoras Agrícolas Las Emprendedoras”. This is her sixth loan with MFP and she is grateful for the financial support that has been provided to her in a constant manner. She now has the means to improve her business and promises to be punctual with her payments, thus demonstrating that she will be responsible. Lourdes will invest the money she requested in the purchase of several sacks of organic compost that she can distribute among her crops.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic compost.

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en: Mwajuma is a 23-year-old married mother of two children who are in school. She has a fruit and vegetable stand that she runs out of her home.  She started her business 3 years ago; thanks to it, she has been able to achieve good results. With this loan she will buy a larger quantity of fruits and vegetables such as watermelons, oranges, bananas, cabbages, kale, etc. This will allow her to earn more and to continue supporting her family and cover her children's educational expenses.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is 27 years old, married, and has no children yet. He lives in the Shimoni neighborhood in the town of Msambweni, Kenya. He has a small business selling fish, and his wife works as a tailor in the same neighborhood. Both of them are devoted to their work so as to achieve a better future for themselves and for their anticipated children. David will invest his loan in buying more fish to increase his stock.  His goal is to grow his business and soon he plans to open a retail shop so that he can continue supporting his partner. This is his first loan cycle with Yehu.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine as well as some clothes

loans.name: Jose Orlando

texts.es: José tiene 30 años de edad está casado vive en la ciudad de  Quevedo  provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 3 hijos que asisten a una escuela cercana a su vivienda. José desde pequeño siempre le ha gustado el trabajo del campo.  Años  atrás recibió un seminario  para cultivar hortalizas.  Ahora trabaja cultivando hortalizas y plantas medicinales, con la ayuda de su esposa junto salen a trabajar a las 5 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde. Con el préstamo quiere comprar semillas, fertilizantes etc. Su meta es de terminar su casa y tener más terreno para su negocio de cultivo
texts.en:
José is 30 years old, married, and lives in the city of Quevedo in Los Ríos Province. He has three children who attend a school near his home. From a very young age, José has always enjoyed working in the fields. Years later, he took a seminar on how to grow vegetables. Now he is growing vegetables and medicinal plants with the help of his wife. They work together from 5 A.M. to 4 P.M.

With this loan, José will buy seeds, fertilizers, and other supplies. His goal is to finish his house and to have more land for his farming business.

loans.use: to buy buy seeds, fertilizers, and other supplies.

loans.name: Aquilino

texts.en:
Aquilino works hard to earn a living. He is a man who is full of hopes for his family. He has been managing his two and a half hectares of rice fields for more than 15 years. He is married and blessed with six children; three of them are married, two are still studying, and one is working. 

Aquilino is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000, which will be used to buy certified seeds as well as to prepare the land on his rice farm. He hopes that this loan will be granted so he can develop his business.

loans.use: to buy certified seeds and prepare the land on his rice farm

loans.name: Maisha Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kakule, trésorière du collectif d’affaire «Maisha », est un entrepreneur dynamique, âgée d’environ 34 ans, mariée, mère de 3 jeunes enfants, qui étudient tous à l’école primaire. Son mari est un enseignant. Elle est sociétaire d’une pharmacie. Environs 13 ans, elle exerce ces petites activités économiques. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser 10 cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Elle commença son entreprise avec un faible capital, reçu de son mari, (argent de son décompte final car son mari travaillait à l’époque dans une organisation  internationale). Ce nouveau prêt  doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec 5 cartons de médicaments essentiels et génériques (paracétamol, quinine, aspirines, les anti inflammatoires, les anti paludéens, les multi vitaminés, les antibiotiques, etc.).En plus, elle souhaite voir ses enfants grandir et accroître son unité d’exploitation. Les bénéfices de son entreprise lui servent à payer la scolarité, la nourriture  pour ses enfants. La cliente remercie Hekima pour ses actions d’autonomisation en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en:
The borrower, Kakule, is the treasurer of the business group "Maisha".  A dynamic entrepreneur, she is about 34 years old, married, and the mother of three young children who all go to elementary school.  Her husband is a teacher and she co-manages a pharmacy.  She has been involved in this business for about 13 years.

Kakule has already completed ten loan cycles with Hekima.  She started her business using as a small capital the final payment received by her husband when he left the international organization he used to work for.

With this new loan, she will buy five boxes of essential and generic medications (paracetamol, quinine, aspirin, anti-inflammatory and antimalarial drugs, multivitamins, antibiotics etc).

Kakule also wishes to see her children grow and she would like to increase the size of her business.  She uses the profits from her activity to buy food for her children and to pay their school fees.

She thanks Hekima for its actions toward the empowerment of low-income women excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to buy fives boxes of essential and generic medications (paracetamol, quinine, aspirin, anti-inflammatories, antimalarial, multivitamins, antibiotics etc...)

loans.name: Madinatou Morenikè's Group

texts.fr: Il s'agit d'un groupe composé de deux femmes en caution solidaire. Agée de 35ans, Madinatou Morenikè la responsable est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. L'aîné et le benjamin ont respectivement 13ans et 03ans. Elle vend des pâtes dentifrices et des brosses à dent au marché depuis 02ans et s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Soucieuse de renforcer sa capacité d'approvisionnement, elle a sollicité et a obtenu ensemble avec sa coéquipière un financement auprès de Finadev. Ce financement lui permettra de maximiser son intérêt et de renforcer son activité. Madinatou Morenikè se retrouve à gauche dans la photo. Les deux clientes exeercent la même activité.
texts.en:
This is a group made up of two women who are co-borrowers. Madinatou Morenikè, the group leader, is 35 years old, married and a mother of three. The eldest and the youngest are 13 and 3 years old, respectively.

Madinatou Morenikè has been selling toothpaste and toothbrushes in the market for two years, and gets her supplies in one of Benin's markets. Intent on increasing stock capacity, she, along with her fellow group member, has sought and obtained a loan from Finadev. This loan will allow her to maximize her interest and to strengthen her business. Madinatou Morenikè is on the left in the photo. Both clients are involved in the same business activity.

loans.use: To purchase five boxes of toothpaste and 10 boxes of toothbrushes.

loans.name: Sègbégnon

texts.fr: Agée de 41ans, Sègbégnon est mariée et mère de 04 enfants scolarisés. L'aîné a 15ans et le benjamin a 7ans. Elle commercialise des articles de la mercerie depuis quelques années. Sa clientèle est essentiellement composée des couturiers de son entourage et elle s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Dans le souci de renforcer son chiffre d'affaire et de satisfaire la demande de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un micro crédit à Finadev. Le revenu supplémentaire dégagé par ce crédit lui permettra de prendre soins de ses enfants et de participer à leur scolarisation.
texts.en:
Sègbégnon, age 41, is a married mother of four children aged 7 to 15 who go to school. She has been selling sewing notions for a few years. Her customer base consists mainly of local tailors. She buys her merchandise at a market in Benin. 

To bolster her sales and meet customer demand, she obtained a loan from Finadev. The additional income earned through this credit will help her to provide for her children and support their education.

loans.use: to buy 5 dozen spools of thread, 6 rolls of poplin, and 4 rolls of lace.

loans.name: Albertine's Group

texts.fr: Il s'agit d'un groupe composé de deux personnes en caution solidaire. Albertine la responsable est âgée de 37ans. Mariée et mère de quatre enfants, le plus âgé a 22ans et le moins âgé 07ans. Albertine est coifeuse de formation. Pour son activité, elle commercialise des mèches pour cheveux. En plus, elle fait du petti commerce à Coté :des plastiques. Albertine s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés de l'extérieur. Dans le souci d'élargir son fonds de commerce et de satisfaire la demande de ses clients, Albertine a sollicité et a obtenu un micro crédit à FINADEV-SA. Albertine se retrouve à gauche dans la photo.
texts.en: This is a group of two people in joint guarantee. Albertine, the leader, is 37 years old. She is married and mother of four children, the oldest is 22 and the youngest 7. Albertine is a trained hairdresser. Her business is selling hair pieces. In addition, she sells plastics on the side. She buys her stock at one of the exterior markets. With a view to expanding her business and satisfying her customers, Albertine has requested and obtained a loan from FINADEV-SA. Albertine is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: to buy 10 locks and 15 plastic containers.

loans.name: Benoite

texts.fr: Benoite est une femme de 45 ans mariée, mère de famille, commerçante. Elle a ouvert une petite boutique près de son domicile dans laquelle elle comercialise les produits et services de première necessité depuis 11 ans déjà. Son activté fonctionne normalement, elle lui permet d'aider son conjopint à résoudre certains besoins quotidiens de leur petite famille. Elle souhaiterai augùmenter augmeter le stock de certains produits qu'elle vend à savcir :un carton de savons, d'huile, augmenter le crédit de communication (pour effectuer les appels et les tranferts aux clients). ceci pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. Le bénéfice que lui apportera ce crédit sera en partie réinvesti dans sa bouitique et le reste lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins quotidiens de sa famille.
texts.en:
Benoite is a 45-year-old woman who is a married mother and a merchant. She opened a small shop near her home where she has been selling basic products and services for eleven years already. Her business is going as planned. It enables her to help out her husband to resolve certain day-to-day needs of their small family. 

Benoite would like to increase her inventory with certain products, which she sells, such as:  a box of soaps and some oil. She would also like to increase her phone credit (to make calls as well as to sell and transfer to her customers), so as to satisfy her customers. The profit that this loan will bring in will in part be invested in her shop, and the rest will allow her to meet the daily needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase in bulk (a box of soap, some oil) and to increase her phone credit

loans.name: Jesudjro 15 Group

texts.fr: JESUDJRO 15 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin et appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine. La représentante du groupe, Léocadie Aboyo (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 49 ans et n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. Veuve et mère de quatre enfants tous scolarisés dont trois restent à sa charge, Léocadie Aboyo assure seule ses diverses charges. Léocadie Aboyo vit seule avec ses enfants et vend depuis huit ans de l’huile de palme pour subvenir à leur besoins. Parallèlement à cette activité que Léocadie Aboyo exerce à son domicile, Léocadie Aboyo vend de l’huile végétale. Léocadie Aboyo s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Léocadie Aboyo sollicite un premier crédit avec les autres membres du groupe JESUDJRO 15. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en: JESUDJRO 15 is a group of three people who all live in the same neighbourhood in Bénin and belong to the same tontine group. The group representative, Léocadie Aboyo (who is raising her hand in the photo), is 49 and never went to school. She is a widowed mother of four children, all of whom are in school, two of whom are still under her care. She takes care of her various responsibilities on her own. She lives alone with her children and has sold palm oil for eight years in order to provide for her family's needs. On top of this business, which she runs from home, she also sells vegetable oil. Léocadie Aboyo buys her products in a market in Bénin. In order to provide better customer satisfaction, Christine is requesting her first loan along with her fellow JESUDJRO 15 group members. This loan will allow them to better respond to their customers' demand and to make more profits.

loans.use: to buy flasks of vegetable oil.

loans.name: Agape Group

texts.fr:
Médiatrice fait partie du groupe Agape et habite à Gitega. Elle a 32ans et est mariée à Donatien, un commerçant de boutique. Ensemble ils ont  4 enfants, âgés de 4  à 10ans, tous étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de boutique (haricot, riz, sel,…) depuis 12 ans.

Elle est à son neuvième  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup d’articles de boutique  (haricot, riz, sel,…) à revendre,  pour gagner plus.

Grâce  au gain de son commerce, elle  parvient à satisfaire les besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Médiatrice belongs to the Agape group and lives in Gitega. She is 32 years old and married to Donatien, who is a shop salesman. They have four children together, ranging from four to ten years old and all at school.

She has been selling beans, rice, salt in a shop for the past ten years.

She is on her ninth loan with Turame. With the KIVA loan she is being granted, she is going to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of shop products (beans, rice, salt) to resell, so that she can make more money.

Thanks to the profits she makes from her business, she manages to provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of products to resell in her shop (beans, rice, salt) and make more money.

loans.name: La Paix Virunga Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kahambu, est le leader du groupe « La paix Virunga », elle est entrepreneur, mariée et mère de 6 jeunes enfants. Son conjoint est sans emploi, toute fois, il réalise de petites commissions sur la vente de parcelle. La cliente est vendeuse de légumes et autres denrées alimentaires. Elle a commence cette affaire avec le crédit de l’IMF Hekima. Le défi de son activité est quand, elle connait de grandes pertes de ses légumes, surtout lorsque, elle ne parvient pas a les écouler le même jour de la cueillette. ce nouveau prêt doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec le Sombe, Bananes, patates douces, etc. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son programme dédié aux petits entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: The customer, Kahambu, is the leader of the "La paix Virunga" group. She is an entrepreneur and married with six young children. Her husband is unemployed, although he makes small commissions on selling pieces of land. The customer sells vegetables and other foods. She began this business with a loan from IMF Hekima. The challenge in her business is when she loses large quantities of her vegetables, above all when she does not manage to sell them the same day as they are picked. This new loan will be used to get fresh supplies of "sombe" (a dish of boiled and pounded cassava leaves), bananas, sweet potatoes etc. She thus thanks Hekima for its program dedicated to small entrepreneurs who cannot access banks.

loans.use: to buy "sombe", bananas and sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Zinduka Group

texts.fr:
René de Dieu fait partie du groupe Zinduka et habite à Gitega. Il a 31 ans et est marié à Evelyne, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants, âgés de 1  à  7 ans, dont un seul étudie.

Il fait le commerce de boutique depuis  5 ans.

Il est à son dixième  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup d’articles de boutique  (caisse de bière Primus ,et de limonade, du savon,..) à revendre,  pour gagner plus.

Grâce  au gain de son commerce, il   nourrit sa famille et paie les frais scolaires de ses enfants.
texts.en:
René de Dieu belongs to the Zinduka group and lives in Gitega. He is 31 years old and married to Evelyne, a farmer. They have three children together, ranging from one to seven years old; only one of the children is at school.

He has been carrying out his shop-selling business for the past five years and is on his tenth loan from Turame. With the KIVA loan he is being granted he is going to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of shop products (a case of Primus beer, lemonade, soap) to resell and make more money.

Thanks to the profit he makes from his business, he can feed his family and pay for his children's schooling.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of shop products (a crate of Primus beer, lemonade, soap..) for resale, in order to make more money.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.fr: Madame Hawa est une femme mariée qui s’active dans le secteur du commerce et pratique la vente la vente de produits locaux tels que poissons fumés ou séchés, huile de palme. Elle s’approvisionne périodiquement  a partir d’un  marché hebdomadaire de la sous région. Elle a une expérience de 22 ans dans son activité. Elle  commence ses activités a 6h du matin pour terminer a 20h le soir.  Les revenus que lui procure son activité lui permettent de participer aux charges de dépense quotidienne au sein de son foyer. Elle est membre d'un des guichets de l'UIMCEC et  sollicite un crédit de 300 000 prévu pour l’achat de poissons séchés et d’huile de palme qui seront destinés a la vente.Elle a déjà remboursé un crédit antérieur au sein de la dite institution. Son objectif est de développer d’avantage son activité de commerce afin d’accroitre ses bénéfices dans le but de pouvoir améliorer les conditions alimentaires de sa famille.Elle souhaite devenir une grande commerçante dans l'avenir.
texts.en: Hawa is a married woman, who is an active trader selling local products such as smoked or dried fish and palm oil. She gets her supplies regularly from a weekly market in the sub-region. She has 22 years' experience in her business. She begins her activity at 6 o'clock in the morning and finishes at 8 o'clock in the evening. The income which she generates from her business allows her to contribute to the daily household expenses. She is a member of one of the branches of UIMCEC and is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs to buy dried fish and palm oil for resale. She has already repaid a previous loan from the same institution. Her aim is to develop her trading activity so that she can increase her profits and be able to improve her family's nutritional conditions. She would like to become a significant businesswoman in the future.

loans.use: to buy local products for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruits and second-hand clothing for resale.

loans.name: Makhsuda

texts.ru: Махсуда  молодая женщина в возрасте   38 лет.   Она замужем  и имеет двоих детей.     Максуда   занимается откармливанием скота у себя дома сама перепродает скот .   По стечению обстоятельств ее муж уехал в Российскую Федерацию и каждый месяц по возможности отправляет семье денежные средства.   Но то что муж отправляет это очень мало и не хватает на проживания поэтому Максуда старается развивать бизнес по откармливанию скота.   От этого вида деятельности она получает хороший доход.    На полученный кредит  Максуда хочет купить скот и увеличить поголовье скота.  Она заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Makhsuda is 38 years old and married with two children.  She raises livestock on her own farm and sells the animals herself.  As luck would have it, Makhsuda's husband left for the Russian Federation and sends the family some money each month, but it is not enough for the family to live on.  This is why Makhsuda wants to increase her livestock business.  She already makes a decent living from this work.  On receiving her loan, Makhsuda wants to buy livestock to increase the number of her herd.  She thanks Arvand in advance for their support.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Odiljon

texts.ru:
Одилджон  очень добрый и ответственный мужчина. Он проживает в посёлке. Одилджон в возрасте 41 года .  Он женат и имеет   пятерых  детей, старший сын учиться в школе, а младшие ходят в детский сад.  Он поздно женился так как сам копил деньги на свою свадьбу. Его жена занимаются домашним хозяйством и воспитанием детей.   Одилджон с 2005 года занимается купля - продажей мелко рогатого скота. Он держит скот на пастбище, а зимой у себя  дома.  Это их единственный доход и поэтому Одилджон хочет развивать этот бизнес.  На полученный кредит хочет купить теленка и откормив продать за хорошую цену и тем самым улучшить свои условия проживания.
 Одилджон заранее выражает свою благодарность Арванду за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Odiljon is a very kind and responsible man who lives in a small village.  He is 41 years old and is married with five children.  His eldest son is still in school and his youngest child is in kindergarten.  Odiljon married late, as he was saving his own money for his wedding.  His wife is a homemaker and she takes care of the children.  Since 2005, Odiljon has been buying and selling small livestock.  He keeps his cattle in a pasture and in the winter at his own home.  This is his only source of income, which is why Odiljon wants to increase his business.  On receiving his loan, he would like to buy a calf to fatten and sell on at a profit to improve his living conditions.  He thanks Arvand in advance for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy a calf

loans.name: Mabinty

texts.en:
Mabinty is 46 years old and married with eight children, aged between 7 years and 28 years. She runs a cookery in Kandeh town, Southern Region in Bo, Sierra Leone. She started this business to raise a permanent income to support her family. She says cookery is the best business for her because her family can eat from the cookery.  

She has been in this business for 12 years and sells cooked food and palm oil at her house; she also receives income from her elder son. She says that her business is doing well.

Mabinty requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy different kinds of foodstuff like bags of rice, vegetable oil and palm oil. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and improve her standard of living. In the future, she would like to see her business expand more. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of foodstuff like bags of rice, vegetable oil and palm oil.

loans.name: Renato

texts.en:
Renato lives in the village known to be mountainous, and almost all of the main source of income comes primarily from corn farming. He is 45 years of age and married with five children. His eldest child settled for marriage while the three left at home are still studying. He aims to have a stable source of income so he can let his children finish their studies and improve their way of living.

Renato raises six hogs, as well as corn crops. He has been running his hog-raising business for seven years. He is really blessed because, even though he is busy raising his hogs, still he has the time to run his farming business well. Renato plans to buy hog feed and farm supplies, but his capital is no longer enough due to an abrupt increase in his household expenses. So he requested a loan of PHP 15,000. He believes that this loan amount will help him attain his goal in life and also help with his livestock business.

loans.use: to buy hog feed and farm supplies for his farming business

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is 28 years old, married, and a father of two children, ages 10 and 5 years. He keeps livestock in his farm and has been in operation for a period of eight years, earning an income of KES 8,000. Daniel is servicing a loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD. This is his first term loan, and he intends to use this amount to purchase more livestock for his farm. The anticipated profits will be used to pay back the loan and for the upkeep of his family. He wishes to prosper in livestock farming and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Hely

texts.es:
Hely, de 25 años es una joven madre. Vive en compañía de su hija Kori, sus hermanos y padres, en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Paccha. Desde su niñez  ha vivido aprendiendo todo lo referente a la agricultura  y heredo  algunas extensiones de terreno de sus padres que en la actualidad cultiva en ellos: papa, maíz, habas entre otros productos más, sus cosechas los vende al por mayor o también por parcela  para que otras personas extraigan el fruto, dependiendo de la situación, mientras espera su cosecha  trabaja como educadora de personas adultas enseñándoles a leer y escribir de donde también  tiene sus ingresos estables, además de poseer 6 ovejas pequeñas, las que lleva a comer en la estancia. Pero como es una mujer trabajadora, también se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogos, donde obtiene buenos ingresos, ya que es la única que tiene este negocio por la zona. Disfruta de cada trabajo que realiza porque le agrada y tiene conocimientos que le permiten desempeñarse de manera óptima, ve el futuro con gran entusiasmo y desea tener mayores ingresos para el futuro de su hija, a la que quiere brindarle lo mejor.  Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “productoras agrícolas las emprendedoras” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, agradece el apoyo financiero que le otorgan de manera constante. Ahora tiene el medio para mejorar su negocio. Promete ser puntual con sus cuotas, ya que le enseñaron a ser responsable.
Hely, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de productos de belleza para su negocio, ya que se encuentra en temporada navideña.
texts.en:
Hely is a 25-year-old mother. She lives along with her daughter Kori, her siblings, and her parents in their own house, located in Paccha. Since she was a little girl, her parents have taught her about agriculture. She inherited some of their land, on which they cultivate potatoes, corn and other products. These crops are sold at wholesale or by the plot so that other people reap the fruit, depending on the circumstances. 

While waiting for the crops, Hely works as a tutor for adults, teaching them to read and write. This gives her another stable source of income. She also owns six small sheep that graze on the farm. Since she is a very hardworking woman, Hely also works selling beauty products from catalogs, where she makes good profits because she has the only business like this in her area. Hely enjoys each of the jobs she does because she learns from them and this allows her to develop fully as a person. 

Hely belongs to the support group "productoras agrícolas las emprendadoras" (agriculture-producing entrepreneurs). This is her fourth loan with MFP. She is grateful for the financial support that they consistently provide to her. Now she has a way to improve her business. Hely has learned to be very responsible and promises to be punctual with her payments. She will use the requested loan to buy beauty products for her business in time for the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Macaria

texts.en:
Macaria is a diligent entrepreneur. Aside from raising hogs to sell, she also manages a retail store for income. She has been selling grocery items for over five years now and earns PHP 8,000 monthly. She has a loving husband, who is her partner in facing difficulties in life. They have four young children who attend school. 

Macaria is now borrowing additional capital of PHP 21,000 to increase her merchandise. This is necessary to meet all her customers' demand for high quality and affordable prices on the commodities that she offers. She will buy eggs, noodles, biscuits, canned goods, shampoo and soap to sell in her retail store. She also will invest part of her loan in buying feed to sustain her hogs.

In the future, Macaria hopes to keep developing her businesses to earn funds for her children's education. It will also help lift her family out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy eggs, noodles, biscuits, canned goods, shampoo and soap to sell in her retail store

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: A retail store owner from Annafunan, Gloria patiently generates income from her business to provide sustenance for her family. She has four children, and two of them attend school while the rest have already acquired employment and sometimes help her in times of need. Gloria still wants to acquire a good income by selling more items but she has inadequate capital. She is now asking for PHP 26,000 to buy more merchandise to sell in her retail business. She will buy sardines, noodles, eggs, soap and detergent to sell. Gloria promises to keep extending friendly services to all her customers and will pay back her loan in full. She hopes to generate a good income to attain financial stability someday.

loans.use: to buy sardines, noodles, eggs, soap and detergent to sell

loans.name: Genaro

texts.en: Genaro is a 42-year-old single man who collects and resells junk products for profit. He has been doing this for five years now. From his business, he is able to generate PHP 8,000 monthly. He helps sustain his parents' needs for meals because they are too old to be involved in a business. He is now asking for a loan of PHP 13,000 to buy more empty cans, jars and bottles to resell for profits. It will help improve his income. Though he has a small business, Genaro hopes to attain a decent life and financial stability for his family someday.

loans.use: to buy more empty cans, jars and bottles to resell for profits

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy beads and an embroidery frame for her embroidery business

loans.name: Victoriano

texts.en: Victoriano is a 43-year-old married man from Panglao, Bohol. He has two children ages eleven and twelve. He has been engaged in motorcycle transport business for the past six years and caters his services by transporting customers from remote areas. Victoriano requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy a tire, gasoline, and for maintenance items like an oil change. Victoriano would like to invest in other ventures to support his family and to finance the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy a tire, gasoline, and for maintenance

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Selling dried fish to the people in her village is how Zenaida earns an income. She has been selling dried fish for more than six years now and gains PHP 8,000 each month. She offers her products on a house-to-house basis. Though she is sometimes very tired, she patiently sells fish for her family's sustenance, including paying for meals and school expenses. 

Zenaida is now 36 years old and married with two children. Her spouse is a farmer. 

Zenaida is now asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy more dried fish to sell. From the help of this loan, she will be able to offer more products and gain more income, too. She is friendly and will always be approachable to her customers. She hopes to educate her children to acquire better employment someday.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Natsagdorj

texts.en:
Mr. Natsagdorj is 55 years old and lives with his wife in Kherlen, the largest city in eastern Mongolia. He has worked as a driver in the Mongolian general department of taxation for 28 years. Now he is a pensioner. His wife, Tserendulam, 52 years old, works as a cleaner in the Mongolian general department of taxation. 

Mr. Natsagdorj owns a plot of land and a house on it. He wants to repair his wooden house. Before the winter comes, they need to repair the house's exterior. As it is, they need to use a lot of coal to stay warm. This is why Mongolia is one of the worst countries for air pollution. 

He is a requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase construction materials such as paint, bricks and cement.

loans.use: to repair the outside of his house.

loans.name: Koba

texts.en:
Koba is 46 years old. He lives in Khoni District with his 68-year-old mother (pensioner) and 29-year-old son. His son has chronic health problems and receives a pension from the local government. Koba requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but met no success. His loan request was rejected every time because of low income and poor family living conditions. 

The only current source of income for the family is from agricultural business. In particular, they have vineyard of 200 vine trees and produce vines to sell locally at good prices. Koba has 0.5 hectares of land where he sows different kinds of vegetables. In addition, the family has a calf. This is hardly enough food for a three-member family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Koba requested a loan from Credo to start-up another family business. His loan request was approved in the frames of new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. Start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, which do not have access to credit products and are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit, Koba will purchase a cow. After purchasing the cow, he will be able to produce dairy and milk products. This will significantly increase the family income. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: Konstantine

texts.en:
Konstantine is 42 years old. He lives in the Tskaltubo district with his wife and mother. Konstantine has requested several previous loans from local financial institutions for his family business start-up without any success. His loan request has been rejected many times because of his low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is the monthly pension from Konstantine’s mother and a small income from a dairy farm. Konstantine has a milk cow, whose milk is used in cheese products. The cheese is sold at the local open market.  

Konstantine is requesting a loan from Credo to restart his family business, which he had to stop due to financial problems. He will use his loan to purchase pigs for starting an animal husbandry business. He will put the pigs in a shed in the yard and after several months the family will be able to sell the piglets for a good price. 

Konstantine's loan request was approved within the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program supports the rural poor who do not have access to credit products since they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” due to their low income. Konstantine's new business initiative, financed with his Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase pigs for starting an animal husbandry business.

loans.name: Munhuu

texts.en:
Munhuu is 42 years old and lives with his wife. He has been running a butcher shop with his wife since 1998, and now his wife has started a new small mail-order business producing traditional boots at home. He purchases livestock from local herders to sell to a local retailer, and his wife sells it at the local market as a retailer, too. 

This borrower has more than 10 years of experience. He does not just purchase and sell livestock to retailers; he also breeds the cattle and sheep to grow them bigger and then sells them to retailers. This is the only income in his family right now, and it is not enough to cover his family expenses and children's upbringing. Munhuu is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase sheep and cattle in order to increase his working capital and income. He is a hardworking, responsible man who believes that if person works hard, life treats him better.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and sheep.

loans.name: Davron

texts.ru: Даврон молодой парень с добрым характером.   Он женат имеет одного ребенка. Он  плотник.  Этим видом деятельности   он занимается более 10-лет.  Изготавливает он разные окна, двери ,полы .  Жена его домохозяйка. Даврон всю свою жизнь мечтал купить компьютер  но ни как не может накопить деньги, все что он зарабатывает все уходит на семейные нужды.   Поэтому он обратился в Арванд за финансовой поддержкой в надежде осуществить свою мечту.  Даврон очень надеется на финансовую поддержку со стороны Арванд и заранее благодарит.
texts.en: Davron is a young man with a kind character. He is married and has one child. He is a carpenter, and has been working in this field for more than 10 years. He makes various kinds of windows, doors, and floors. His wife is a homemaker. His whole life, he has been dreaming of buying a computer, but has never been able to save up enough money because everything he earns goes to meeting his family's needs. For this reason, Davron has come to Arvand for financial support in the hope of realizing his dream. He is really hoping for assistance from Arvand, and is very grateful for the help.

loans.use: to  buy a  computer

loans.name: Zakeria

texts.en:
Zakeria is 31 years old, married, and has two children who attend school. She runs a business of milk sales, which she has been doing for five years. Zakeria has one cow in milk and every morning she milks her cow and prepares liters of milk that her husband takes to the market to sell. She earnss enough to bear the expenses of her family members. 

Zakeria is requesting a loan for 20,000 PKR, which she will use to purchase another cow. She will be able to cater to more customers which will help to bring in more cash. Zakeria desires to use part of revenue on the improvement of her house. She needs to expand her business to fulfill the demands of food, clothing, and education.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Bat-Ireedui

texts.en: Mr. Bat-Ireedui is 32 years old and lives with his parents in an apartment in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His father is a builder and his mother has a trading business. Since 2010, he has been running a taxi business in his own car. He is a very talented person. As a child, he started repairing cars. For this reason he wants to start a new business. He will buy old cars, repair them, and then sell them. He says his new business will be successful because he knows how to fix cars. "It’s my hobby." If his business is successful, his income will increase. He is requesting a loan for 3,500,000 MNT to start this car repair and sales business.

loans.use: to start a new business repairing and selling cars

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki, 28, lives with her daughter, who is completely dependent on her. She works selling dresses, skirts, blouses, baby clothes and other garments. Her business is home-based, and she’s very well-known in the neighborhood for selling clothes at affordable prices, which has brought her many customers.

Riziki is asking Yehu for a loan to stock her business. She will buy khangas of different colors to catch more people’s eye, thus expanding her clientele. This will be very positive for Riziki in that she’ll earn more profits.

loans.use: to buy more bales of khangas to sell.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en: Nilda is a hardworking mother who is raising her four children to be kind and helpful. She is married to a farmer, while she operates a small store for income. She sells grocery items and is in need of additional capital to invest in buying noodles, biscuits, bread, vinegar, cooking oil and soap to sell. This will help improve her sales and income. She is borrowing 17,000 PHP. She hopes to make her business profitable and gain a good income for her children's education expenses.

loans.use: to buy noodles, biscuits, bread, vinegar, cooking oil and soap to sell.

loans.name: Mwanatumu

texts.en:
Everyone has the desire to better themselves and move forward at some point in their lives. For this reason, 39-year-old Mwanatumu, who lives with her family in their own house, has started a business that will help her to make a better future for herself.
 
Mwanatumu makes a living selling fruits and vegetables such as tomatoes, onions, chilies, oranges, and more. She has experience in sales, which allows her to make a good profit. She has gained many customers who prefer to buy from her for the quality, good prices, and, above all, the excellent customer service. 

She is an active and entrepreneurial woman dedicated to her work. She wants to increase her inventory, but she does not have enough capital to do so. For this reason she is asking Yehu for a loan that will allow her to buy fruits and vegetables in bulk. She is confident that this loan will give her family a full life.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables in bulk.

loans.name: Durmo

texts.ru: Дурмо  женщина в возрасте 50 лет.  Она замужем, имеет четверых  детей и  шесть внуков.   Она занимается торговлей продуктами питания в продуктовом магазине уже более 10-лет.  Она  2005 года является нашим активным клиентом, и кредиты которые она получает она погашает вовремя.  Дурмо очень пунктуальная и ответственная женщина.  Ее муж дехканин и не имеет большого дохода.  Основной доход у них от продажи продуктов  питания. Для расширения своего бизнеса  Дурмо хочет получить кредит и закупить продукты питания. Она  заранее благодарит Арванд за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Durmo is 50 years old. She is married and has 4 children and 6 grandchildren. She works in retail, and has been selling food in a grocery store for over 10 years. She has been an active client of ours since 2005, and has always paid off all her loans on time. Durmo is a punctual and responsible woman. Her husband is a farmer and does not have a high salary. Their main income comes from selling groceries. To expand her business, Durmo is now seeking a loan to buy food. She thanks Arvand in advance for the financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy food

loans.name: Allan Fernando

texts.es: El joven Allan tiene 29 años de edad, es estudiante de la carrera de ingeniería en telecomunicaciones de 4 años de duración, actualmente labora como profesor imparte clases de matemáticas y física con su salario cubre sus gastos básicos, el cuenta con una beca para sus estudios pero el curso lo tienen que costear de su bolsillo por tal razón Allan solicita apoyo de crédito para poder pagar el curso de titulación de su carrera, para él es muy importante este gran paso ya que le ayudara a desarrollarse más en su trabajo y le permitirá aportar un mayor apoyo económico a su familia, ya que es una persona con muchos deseos de superación y le gusta desafiar nuevos retos y cumplir con las metas que se traza.
texts.en:
Allan is a young twenty-nine-year-old man.  He is a student in the four-year telecommunications engineering program.  He currently works as a professor, teaching math and physics classes.  With his salary, he covers basic expenses.  He counts on a scholarship for his studies but he has to pay the final fees out of his pocket.  For this reason, Allan is asking for a loan to be able to pay the final fees to officialize his degree. 

For him, this is a very important big step.  It will help him develop himself more in his work and will allow him to provide a greater economic support to his family.  He is a person with many wishes of improvement and he likes to take on new challenges and follow through on the goals he has laid out for himself.

loans.use: to pay his final fees to officialize his degree.

loans.name: Davaadagva

texts.en: Mr. Davaadagva is 52 years old and lives with his wife in a ger (traditional Mongolian yurt) in Orhon province, Mongolia. His wife, Munhbayar, is 53 years old and is going to help her husband to run his new business manufacturing Mongolian yurts. He and his wife have started making parts of Mongolian yurts. He also started planting organic vegetables this past spring. He estimates this business will be profitable enough to cover his family's expenses and to save for their grandchildren's education. He is a hardworking and open-minded person who is planning to built a storage pit to reserve vegetables to sell during colder winter months at higher prices than in the fall, when he earns the lowest prices of the year. He needs 2,500,000 MNT to purchase construction materials for building the storage pit for his organic vegetable business.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for building a storage pit for vegetables

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a single mother of three children, one of whom goes to school. She takes care of additional family members (her cousin, sisters, and brother) too. She has a business selling second-hand clothes and has been in this business for 10 years. She generates additional income from rental rooms. She works six days a week at the market and sells to all categories of people, but on a retail basis only. 

She has applied for a loan of 2000000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and to educate her children up to university. She resides at her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, utility bills and food costs for her family.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia is 52 years old and has one grown child. For one year, Rukia has sold food in the streets. She works from 7:00 in the morning until noon. She mostly sells breakfast. She wishes to make improvements in her business, but she does not have enough capital. For this reason, she is asking for assistance from Yehu to buy more ingredients like wheat flour, cooking oil, baking powder, peas, and so on.

Rukia hopes to increase sales and thus her income with this investment so she can provide herself with a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients like wheat flour, cooking oil, baking powder, and peas.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is a 39-year-old, married woman from Panglao, Bohol. She has six children. The oldest child is 14, while the youngest is 8 months old. 

Jessica engages in a food vending business. She sells home cooked vegetables in the community. She has been in the food vending business for 5 years. Aside from food vending, she also engages in an electronic retail load business. She earns 5,000 PHP a month by doing both businesses. 

Jessica requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase additional ingredients like vegetables and capital for the load business. In the future, Jessica would like improve her business to invest in other ventures to support her family and at the same time to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like vegetables, and to purchase more load

loans.name: Accesorios Clemente Group

texts.es: El grupo Accesorios Clemente lleva tres ciclos solicitando crédito a la institución y nos platican que están muy contentos y agradecidos porque gracias al crédito han crecido mucho, Don Jesús es el representante del grupo él tiene 28 años de edad vive en unión libre con la señora Josefina desde hace 10 años juntos han formado una familia con tres niños dos de ellos van a la escuela. Don Jesús y doña Josefina tienen negocio familiar de accesorios de autos donde venden foscos de colores, estampas, aromatizantes para autos, volantes, micas tapetes etc. Esta vez ellos están solicitando el crédito para comprar más productos que le hacen falta como cables para instalaciones de sus alarmas don Jesús nos platica “Anteriormente no sabía cómo se realizaba la instalación de las alarmas sin embargo estoy tomando clases para aprender y sacar adelante mi negocio ya que la dificultad que presento es no saber cómo manejar  mi negocio porque hace poco que lo inicie ya aunque , y lo inicie porque mi papa se dedicaba a esto” Don Jesús apenas tiene tres años con su negocio. La meta de don  Jesús es hacer crecer su negocio pero también le gustaría que en un futuro podría colocar un nuevo negocio cercas de su casa, porque en donde tiene actualmente su negocio de accesorios solo es prestado y tiene que estar pagando mensualmente la renta y es un gasto para su familia que obligatoriamente tiene que hacer. Dentro del grupo participa Jessica quien tiene una tienda es hermana de Don Jesús.
texts.en: The "Accesorios Clemente" ["Clemente Accessories"] group has been through three loan cycles with the institution, and they comment that they are very happy and grateful, since thanks to the loans they have grown a lot. Jesús is the group's representative. He is 28 years old and has lived in a common-law marriage with Josefina for 10 years. Together they have formed a family with three children, two of whom go to school. Jesús and Josefina have a family business selling auto accessories. They sell colored bulbs, decals, car deodorizers, steering wheels, floor mats, etc. This time they are requesting the loan to buy more products that they need, such as cables for the installation of their alarms. Jesús comments: “Previously I didn't know how to carry out the installation of the alarms, but I am taking classes to learn and to make progress with my business, since the difficulty that arose is not knowing how to manage my business, because I only started it recently, and I started it because my papa worked in this field." Jesús only has three years of experience with his business. Jesús' goal is to make his business grow, but he would also like it if in the future he could set up a new business near his home, because the space where he currently has his accessories business is only lent to him, and he has to pay the rent monthly, which is an expense for his family that he is obligated to pay. Within the group, Jessica also participates; she is Jesús' sister and operates a store.

loans.use: to buy steering wheel covers, hubcaps, alarm equipment, speakers, light covers and lightbulbs.

loans.name: Marthaline  K.

texts.en: Marthaline K., 49, lives in Paynesville South with her husband and five children, who are between the ages of 9 and 31. Five of the children live outside the home, and are independent, while two of the children stay with her at home and are attending school. For the past ten years, she has been retailing coal in her community. She makes a profit when she sells because she is the only one doing this job in her community. Now, she is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of coal to sell. Her dream is to build a warehouse, where she can sell coal wholesale and retail.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of coal to sell.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en: Jonathan has been in the business of raising hogs. He is 27 years of age, married and has only one child. Jonathan currently raises 15 fattening hogs and 2 sows. With the large number of pigs, he is in need of more capital to sustain all their hog feed and necessary vitamins to ensure proper growth upon reaching their maturity period. With regards to this matter, he is seeking a loan of 30,000 PHP. He is hoping for continuous access to financial services from lenders for him to have a stable business.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and hog feed for his pigs

loans.name: Mwanahamisi

texts.en:
Mwanahamisi is 50 years old, widowed and has two children. She lives with her family in Shimoni neighborhood, in the town of Msambweni.

For the past 10 years, Mwanahamisi has been selling fried cassava. She is requesting this loan to buy more stock of cassava, cooking oil, and a bigger frying pan. The support of this loan will enable her to continue making money which will allow her to support her household. Her goal is to own a kiosk. 

This is her second loan cycle with Yehu and she hopes to be punctual in making her loan repayments.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cassava, cooking oil, and a bigger frying pan.

loans.name: Manzoran

texts.en:
Manzoran is a 53-year-old married woman. She has ten years of experience in the field of embroidery. She has become famous for providing unique and attractive embroidered designs in her community and in the local market. The retailers wait for Manzoran to bring in her well-prepared inventory, and they pay her well for her hard work. 

However, Manzoran’s business was not this successful in past years. She had few resources, especially material and machines for embroidery, and mobility was not so easy. Her five children were barely provided with basic necessities, for their father was the sole breadwinner and did not make sufficient income to support the family’s growing needs. It was in such challenging circumstances that Manzoran borrowed funds from Kashf and invested them in  her fading business. She has been associated with Kashf for four years. Now she has requested a loan of 25,000 PKR to buy reels of thread in different colors and packs of sequins, pearls and glittering material to embellish her clothes. She is hopeful that she can increase her net income by making orders on time. She desires to provide a high-quality education to her children.

loans.use: to buy reels of thread in different colors and packs of sequins, pearls, and glittering material.

loans.name: Joey

texts.en:
Joey raises four fattening hogs within his local community. He has been in this kind of business for 3 years. Aside from livestock, he is also engaged in a farming business wherein he manages two hectares of corn field and 3,000 square meters of rice field.  

Joey would like to have a continuous source of income so he is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP, allowing him to buy livestock feed. Some of the loan will be used for maintenance of his farming business. Joey hopes that his rice and corn production will be more productive so he could sustain all their family needs and gain better profits. In this way, he could improve his financial stability and improve his living condition.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed and for maintenance of corn farming business

loans.name: Navchaa

texts.en: Mrs. Navchaa is 27 years old and lives with her husband and 1-year-old daughter in a wooden house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Her house is located in a boundary area of the city with no running water, minimal roads, and spotty electricity. Since 2008, she has been working as a social worker at the St. Mary’s hospital under the jurisdiction of Representative Board of Vatican. And her husband works as a taxi driver for a taxi service company. Her job is in the city's downtown area. She spends four hours a day commuting, and she takes three types of buses during a one-way journey. She and her husband have been saving their incomes for two years to buy a used car. Her income is not enough for a normal car; she lacks 1,450,000 MNT. The loan Navchaa is taking out will be used to buy a used car in good condition, in order to spend more time with her family and to run a taxi business between her job and home.

loans.use: to buy a used car in good condition

loans.name: Maria  Cerina

texts.en:
Maria Cerina is 39 years old, married, and has three children. She is from Antequera, Bohol. Her husband is an electrician. She is engaged in basket weaving, which she has been doing for 12 years. She earns 4,000 PHP per month.  

Maria Cerina is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more nito or native palm to produce native baskets. She would like to improve her business to raise her standard of living and support the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase nito (native palm).

loans.name: Grace Lum

texts.en:
Grace Lum is separated and has two children. She lives in Bamenda, North West Region of Cameroon. She has encountered a number of problems in life, including the death of family members, sickness in her family, and theft. She reached the turning point of her life when she joined GHAPE in 2010.  

Grace Lum sells drinks.  She is requesting her second loan from GHAPE, which she will use to buy more drinks for her off license, which was opened with the help of the first loan. She will also buy more crates, bottles, and comfortable chairs and construct a counter to display her drinks.  She is positive that her business will succeed because she will offer all types of drinks. She has regular customers with a good business site and the community will benefit from the regular supply of drinks which is mostly consumed during ceremonies.

With the profit from the loan, Grace Lum will provide good food to her children and sponsor their education. She prefer a loan from  GHAPE  because of low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals, and advice on business management.

loans.use: to purchase of crates and bottles.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
She is married and has five children, and they live in a five bedroom apartment in Bamenda, Mezam division North West Region of Cameroon. She has faced so many challenges in life -- including sickness of family members, and the deaths of her mother and her father, who were so supportive of her -- that she became frustrated with the ways of life. 

She joined GHAPE in the year 2010, and has successfully managed and repaid GHAPE loans twice before. Given a new loan, she will expand her pig farm by buying more piglets and pig feed, and also she will expand her restaurant business by buying cooking ingredients, like rice, oil, beans and maize, which will facilitate the proper functioning of her restaurant. 

She believes that her businesses will succeed, because she has regular customers who frequently buy from her. She has a good business site for the restaurant, which together with the quality food she serves, attracts more customers. From this activity the community will benefit, having a regular food supply at moderate prices. The pig droppings will serve as fertilizer for the community's crop land, for which there is high demand, and it will greatly increase farm productivity.

With the profit from this loan, she will educate her children and provide basic necessities. She will also plough back profit into the businesses. She prefers a loan from GHAPE because of low interest rates, the management and marketing techniques thought by GHAPE staff.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed for her pig farm, and to buy cooking ingredients for her restaurant, like rice, oil, beans and maize.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy maize and beans to resell.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is married and the father of seven children who live in a three-bedroom house in the Mankon Bamenda in the North West Region of Cameroon. He has faced many challenges, including securing inadequate funds to educate his children, and many tragedies, including family disputes, a fire, armed robbery, the death of family members, and fighting to get his family property. He joined GHAPE in 2010 and has taken and repaid one loan. 

He promises that if gets the new loan he is applying for, he will open a poultry farm after using the money to buy chicks and the supplies he needs to care for them. He says that his business will succeed because he lives in a community that is suffering from inadequate poultry farms and because he has a good business site. He also says that the community will benefit from having access to poultry at moderate prices, including for use in ceremonies.
